Entropy Framework
Package entropy :: Module db

Source Code for Module entropy.db

   1  # -*- coding: utf-8 -*- 
   2  """ 
   3   
   4      @author: Fabio Erculiani <lxnay@sabayonlinux.org> 
   5      @contact: lxnay@sabayonlinux.org 
   6      @copyright: Fabio Erculiani 
   7      @license: GPL-2 
   8   
   9      B{Entropy Framework repository database module}. 
  10      Entropy repositories (server and client) are implemented as relational 
  11      databases. Currently, EntropyRepository class is the object that wraps 
  12      sqlite3 database queries and repository logic: there are no more 
  13      abstractions between the two because there is only one implementation 
  14      available at this time. In future, entropy.db will feature more backends 
  15      such as MySQL embedded, SparQL, remote repositories support via TCP socket, 
  16      etc. This will require a new layer between the repository interface now 
  17      offered by EntropyRepository and the underlying data retrieval logic. 
  18      Every repository interface available inherits from EntropyRepository 
  19      class and has to reimplement its own Schema subclass and its get_init 
  20      method (see EntropyRepository documentation for more information). 
  21   
  22      I{EntropyRepository} is the sqlite3 implementation of the repository 
  23      interface, as written above. 
  24   
  25      I{ServerRepositoryStatus} is a singleton containing the status of 
  26      server-side repositories. It is used to determine if repository has 
  27      been modified (tainted) or has been revision bumped already. 
  28      Revision bumps are automatic and happen on the very first data "commit". 
  29      Every repository features a revision number which is stored into the 
  30      "packages.db.revision" file. Only server-side (or community) repositories 
  31      are subject to this automation (revision file update on commit). 
  32   
  33      @todo: migrate to "_" (underscore) convention 
  34   
  35  """ 
  36   
  37  from __future__ import with_statement 
  38  import os 
  39  import shutil 
  40  from entropy.const import etpConst, etpCache 
  41  from entropy.exceptions import IncorrectParameter, InvalidAtom, \ 
  42      SystemDatabaseError, OperationNotPermitted 
  43  from entropy.i18n import _ 
  44  from entropy.output import brown, bold, red, blue, purple, darkred, darkgreen, \ 
  45      TextInterface 
  46  from entropy.cache import EntropyCacher 
  47  from entropy.core import Singleton, SystemSettings 
  48  from entropy.spm import get_spm 
  49   
  50  try: # try with sqlite3 from >=python 2.5 
  51      from sqlite3 import dbapi2 
  52  except ImportError: # fallback to pysqlite 
  53      try: 
  54          from pysqlite2 import dbapi2 
  55      except ImportError, e: 
  56          raise SystemError( 
  57              "%s. %s: %s" % ( 
  58                  _("Entropy needs Python compiled with sqlite3 support"), 
  59                  _("Error"), 
  60                  e, 
  61              ) 
  62          ) 
  63   

  64 -class ServerRepositoryStatus(Singleton):

  67      Server-side Repositories status information container.

  70 -    def init_singleton(self): 

  71          """ Singleton "constructor" """ 
  72          self.__data = {} 
  73          self.__updates_log = {} 

  74   

  75 -    def __create_if_necessary(self, db): 

  76          if db not in self.__data: 
  77              self.__data[db] = {} 
  78              self.__data[db]['tainted'] = False 
  79              self.__data[db]['bumped'] = False 
  80              self.__data[db]['unlock_msg'] = False 

  81   

  82 -    def set_unlock_msg(self, db): 

  83          """ 
  84          Set bit which determines if the unlock warning has been already 
  85          printed to user. 
  86   
  87          @param db: database identifier 
  88          @type db: string 
  89          """ 
  90          self.__create_if_necessary(db) 
  91          self.__data[db]['unlock_msg'] = True 

  92   

  93 -    def unset_unlock_msg(self, db): 

  94          """ 
  95          Unset bit which determines if the unlock warning has been already 
  96          printed to user. 
  97   
  98          @param db: database identifier 
  99          @type db: string 
 100          """ 
 101          self.__create_if_necessary(db) 
 102          self.__data[db]['unlock_msg'] = False 

 103

 107          modified. 
 108   
 109          @param db: database identifier 
 110          @type db: string 
 111          """ 
 112          self.__create_if_necessary(db) 
 113          self.__data[db]['tainted'] = True

 119

 121          @type db: string 
 122          """ 
 123          self.__create_if_necessary(db) 
 124          self.__data[db]['tainted'] = False 

 125

 134          self.__create_if_necessary(db) 
 135          self.__data[db]['bumped'] = True

 143          @type db: string 
 144          """ 
 145          self.__create_if_necessary(db) 
 146          self.__data[db]['bumped'] = False 

 147   

 148 -    def is_tainted(self, db): 

 149          """ 
 150          Return whether repository which db points to has been modified. 
 151   
 152          @param db: database identifier 
 153          @type db: string 
 154          """ 
 155          self.__create_if_necessary(db) 
 156          return self.__data[db]['tainted'] 

 157

 164          """ 
 165          self.__create_if_necessary(db) 
 166          return self.__data[db]['bumped']

 168 -    def is_unlock_msg(self, db):

 172

 175          """ 
 176          self.__create_if_necessary(db) 
 177          return self.__data[db]['unlock_msg'] 

 178   

 179 -    def get_updates_log(self, db): 

 180          """ 
 181          Return dict() object containing metadata related to package 
 182          updates occured in a server-side repository. 
 183          """ 
 184          if db not in self.__updates_log: 
 185              self.__updates_log[db] = {} 
 186          return self.__updates_log[db]

 188 -class EntropyRepository: 

 189   
 190      """ 
 191      EntropyRepository implements SQLite3 based storage. In a Model-View based 
 192      pattern, it can be considered the "model". 
 193      Actually it's the only one available but more model backends will be 
 194      supported in future (which will inherit this class directly). 
 195   
 196      Every Entropy repository storage interface MUST inherit from this base 
 197      class. 
 198   
 199      @todo: refactoring and generalization needed 
 200      """ 
 201

 218                      trigger INTEGER 
 219                  );

 479   
 480      import entropy.tools as entropyTools 
 481      import entropy.dump as dumpTools 
 482      import threading 

 483 -    def __init__(self, readOnly = False, noUpload = False, dbFile = None, 
 484          clientDatabase = False, xcache = False, dbname = etpConst['serverdbid'], 
 485          indexing = True, OutputInterface = None, skipChecks = False, 
 486          useBranch = None, lockRemote = True): 

 487   
 488          """ 
 489          EntropyRepository constructor. 
 490   
 491          @keyword readOnly: open file in read-only mode 
 492          @type readOnly: bool 
 493          @keyword noUpload: server-side setting for not allowing database 
 494              uploads when remote revision is lower than local 
 495          @type noUpload: bool 
 496          @keyword dbFile: path to database to open 
 497          @type dbFile: string 
 498          @keyword clientDatabase: state that EntropyRepository instance is 
 499              a client-side one 
 500          @type clientDatabase: bool 
 501          @keyword xcache: enable on-disk cache 
 502          @type xcache: bool 
 503          @keyword dbname: EntropyRepository instance identifier 
 504          @type dbname: string 
 505          @keyword indexing: enable database indexes 
 506          @type indexing: bool 
 507          @keyword OutputInterface: interface used to communicate with the user. 
 508              must inherit entropy.output.TextInterface 
 509          @type OutputInterface: entropy.output.TextInterface based instance 
 510          @keyword skipChecks: if True, skip integrity checks 
 511          @type skipChecks: bool 
 512          @keyword useBranch: if True, it won't use SystemSettings' branch 
 513              setting but rather the one provided 
 514          @type useBranch: string 
 515          @keyword lockRemote: determine whether remote server-side database 
 516              should be locked when updating the local version 
 517          @type lockRemote: bool 
 518          """ 
 519   
 520          self.SystemSettings = SystemSettings() 
 521          self.srv_sys_settings_plugin = \ 
 522              etpConst['system_settings_plugins_ids']['server_plugin'] 
 523          self.dbMatchCacheKey = etpCache['dbMatch'] 
 524          self.client_settings_plugin_id = etpConst['system_settings_plugins_ids']['client_plugin'] 
 525          self.db_branch = self.SystemSettings['repositories']['branch'] 
 526          self.Cacher = EntropyCacher() 
 527   
 528          self.dbname = dbname 
 529          self.lockRemote = lockRemote 
 530          if self.dbname == etpConst['clientdbid']: 
 531              self.db_branch = None 
 532          if useBranch != None: 
 533              self.db_branch = useBranch 
 534   
 535          if OutputInterface is None: 
 536              OutputInterface = TextInterface() 
 537   
 538          if dbFile is None: 
 539              raise IncorrectParameter("IncorrectParameter: %s" % ( 
 540                  _("valid database path needed"),) ) 
 541   
 542          self.__write_mutex = self.threading.RLock() 
 543          self.dbapi2 = dbapi2 
 544          # setup output interface 
 545          self.OutputInterface = OutputInterface 
 546          self.updateProgress = self.OutputInterface.updateProgress 
 547          self.askQuestion = self.OutputInterface.askQuestion 
 548          # setup service interface 
 549          self.readOnly = readOnly 
 550          self.noUpload = noUpload 
 551          self.clientDatabase = clientDatabase 
 552          self.xcache = xcache 
 553          self.indexing = indexing 
 554          self.skipChecks = skipChecks 
 555          if not self.skipChecks: 
 556              if not self.entropyTools.is_user_in_entropy_group(): 
 557                  # forcing since we won't have write access to db 
 558                  self.indexing = False 
 559              # live systems don't like wasting RAM 
 560              if self.entropyTools.islive(): 
 561                  self.indexing = False 
 562          self.dbFile = dbFile 
 563          self.dbclosed = True 
 564          self.server_repo = None 
 565   
 566          if not self.clientDatabase: 
 567              self.server_repo = self.dbname[len(etpConst['serverdbid']):] 
 568              self._create_dbstatus_data() 
 569   
 570          if not self.skipChecks: 
 571              # no caching for non root and server connections 
 572              if (self.dbname.startswith(etpConst['serverdbid'])) or \ 
 573                  (not self.entropyTools.is_user_in_entropy_group()): 
 574                  self.xcache = False 
 575          self.live_cache = {} 
 576   
 577          # create connection 
 578          self.connection = self.dbapi2.connect(dbFile, timeout=300.0, 
 579              check_same_thread = False) 
 580          self.cursor = self.connection.cursor() 
 581   
 582          if not self.skipChecks: 
 583              try: 
 584                  if os.access(self.dbFile, os.W_OK) and \ 
 585                      self.doesTableExist('baseinfo') and \ 
 586                      self.doesTableExist('extrainfo'): 
 587   
 588                      if self.entropyTools.islive(): # this works 
 589                          if etpConst['systemroot']: 
 590                              self._databaseStructureUpdates() 
 591                      else: 
 592                          self._databaseStructureUpdates() 
 593   
 594              except self.dbapi2.Error: 
 595                  self.cursor.close() 
 596                  self.connection.close() 
 597                  raise 
 598   
 599          # now we can set this to False 
 600          self.dbclosed = False 

 601   

 602 -    def setCacheSize(self, size): 

 603          """ 
 604          Change low-level, storage engine based cache size. 
 605   
 606          @param size: new size 
 607          @type size: int 
 608          """ 
 609          self.cursor.execute('PRAGMA cache_size = '+str(size)) 

 610   

 611 -    def setDefaultCacheSize(self, size): 

 612          """ 
 613          Change default low-level, storage engine based cache size. 
 614   
 615          @param size: new default size 
 616          @type size: int 
 617          """ 
 618          self.cursor.execute('PRAGMA default_cache_size = '+str(size)) 

 619   
 620   

 621 -    def __del__(self): 

 622          if not self.dbclosed: 
 623              self.closeDB() 

 624   

 625 -    def _create_dbstatus_data(self): 

 626          """ 
 627          Server-side function that setups server status information 
 628          """ 
 629          from entropy.server.interfaces import Server 
 630          srv = Server() 
 631          taint_file = srv.get_local_database_taint_file(self.server_repo) 
 632          if os.path.isfile(taint_file): 
 633              dbs = ServerRepositoryStatus() 
 634              dbs.set_tainted(self.dbFile) 
 635              dbs.set_bumped(self.dbFile) 

 636   

 637 -    def closeDB(self): 

 638          """ 
 639          Close repository storage communication. 
 640          Note: once issues this, you won't be able to use such instance 
 641          anymore. 
 642          """ 
 643          self.dbclosed = True 
 644   
 645          # if the class is opened readOnly, close and forget 
 646          if self.readOnly: 
 647              self.cursor.close() 
 648              self.connection.close() 
 649              return 
 650   
 651          if self.clientDatabase: 
 652              self.commitChanges() 
 653              self.cursor.close() 
 654              self.connection.close() 
 655              return 
 656   
 657          sts = ServerRepositoryStatus() 
 658          if not sts.is_tainted(self.dbFile): 
 659              # we can unlock it, no changes were made 
 660              from entropy.server.interfaces import Server 
 661              srv = Server() 
 662              srv.MirrorsService.lock_mirrors(False, repo = self.server_repo) 
 663          elif not sts.is_unlock_msg(self.dbFile): 
 664              u_msg = _("Mirrors have not been unlocked. Remember to sync them.") 
 665              self.updateProgress( 
 666                  darkgreen(u_msg), 
 667                  importance = 1, 
 668                  type = "info", 
 669                  header = brown(" * ") 
 670              ) 
 671              sts.set_unlock_msg(self.dbFile) # avoid spamming 
 672   
 673          self.commitChanges() 
 674          self.cursor.close() 
 675          self.connection.close() 

 676   

 677 -    def vacuum(self): 

 678          """ 
 679          Repository storage cleanup and optimization function. 
 680          """ 
 681          self.cursor.execute("vacuum") 

 682   

 683 -    def commitChanges(self, force = False): 

 684          """ 
 685          Commit actual changes and make them permanently stored. 
 686   
 687          @keyword force: force commit, despite read-only bit being set 
 688          @type force: bool 
 689          """ 
 690          if self.readOnly and not force: 
 691              return 
 692   
 693          try: 
 694              self.connection.commit() 
 695          except self.dbapi2.Error: 
 696              pass 
 697   
 698          if not self.clientDatabase: 
 699              self.taintDatabase() 
 700              dbs = ServerRepositoryStatus() 
 701              if (dbs.is_tainted(self.dbFile)) and \ 
 702                  (not dbs.is_bumped(self.dbFile)): 
 703                  # bump revision, setting DatabaseBump causes 
 704                  # the session to just bump once 
 705                  dbs.set_bumped(self.dbFile) 
 706                  self._revisionBump() 

 707   

 708 -    def taintDatabase(self): 

 709          """ 
 710          Server-side method that render your repository storage tainted, 
 711          modified. 
 712          """ 
 713          # if it's equo to open it, this should be avoided 
 714          from entropy.server.interfaces import Server 
 715          srv = Server() 
 716          # taint the database status 
 717          taint_file = srv.get_local_database_taint_file(repo = self.server_repo) 
 718          f = open(taint_file, "w") 
 719          f.write(etpConst['currentarch']+" database tainted\n") 
 720          f.flush() 
 721          f.close() 
 722          ServerRepositoryStatus().set_tainted(self.dbFile) 

 723   

 724 -    def untaintDatabase(self): 

 725          """ 
 726          Server-side method that render your repository storage NOT tainted, 
 727          modified. 
 728          """ 
 729          # if it's equo to open it, this should be avoided 
 730          from entropy.server.interfaces import Server 
 731          srv = Server() 
 732          ServerRepositoryStatus().unset_tainted(self.dbFile) 
 733          # untaint the database status 
 734          taint_file = srv.get_local_database_taint_file(repo = self.server_repo) 
 735          if os.path.isfile(taint_file): 
 736              os.remove(taint_file) 

 737   

 738 -    def _revisionBump(self): 

 739          """ 
 740          Entropy repository revision bumping function. Every time it's called, 
 741          revision is incremented by 1. 
 742          """ 
 743          from entropy.server.interfaces import Server 
 744          srv = Server() 
 745          revision_file = srv.get_local_database_revision_file( 
 746              repo = self.server_repo) 
 747          if not os.path.isfile(revision_file): 
 748              revision = 1 
 749          else: 
 750              f = open(revision_file, "r") 
 751              revision = int(f.readline().strip()) 
 752              revision += 1 
 753              f.close() 
 754          f = open(revision_file, "w") 
 755          f.write(str(revision)+"\n") 
 756          f.flush() 
 757          f.close() 

 758   

 759 -    def isDatabaseTainted(self): 

 760          """ 
 761          Server-side function used to determine whether repository database 
 762          has been modified. 
 763   
 764          @return: taint status 
 765          @rtype: bool 
 766          """ 
 767          from entropy.server.interfaces import Server 
 768          srv = Server() 
 769          taint_file = srv.get_local_database_taint_file(repo = self.server_repo) 
 770          if os.path.isfile(taint_file): 
 771              return True 
 772          return False 

 773   

 774 -    def initializeDatabase(self): 

 775          """ 
 776          WARNING: it will erase your database. 
 777          This method (re)initialize the repository, dropping all its content. 
 778          """ 
 779          my = self.Schema() 
 780          for table in self.listAllTables(): 
 781              try: 
 782                  self.cursor.execute("DROP TABLE %s" % (table,)) 
 783              except self.dbapi2.OperationalError: 
 784                  # skip tables that can't be dropped 
 785                  continue 
 786          self.cursor.executescript(my.get_init()) 
 787          self._databaseStructureUpdates() 
 788          # set cache size 
 789          self.setCacheSize(8192) 
 790          self.setDefaultCacheSize(8192) 
 791          self.commitChanges() 

 792   

 793 -    def filterTreeUpdatesActions(self, actions): 

 794          """ 
 795          This method should be considered internal and not suited for general 
 796          audience. Given a raw package name/slot updates list, it returns 
 797          the action that should be really taken because not applied. 
 798   
 799          @param actions: list of raw treeupdates actions, for example: 
 800              ['move x11-foo/bar app-foo/bar', 'slotmove x11-foo/bar 2 3'] 
 801          @type actions: list 
 802          @return: list of raw treeupdates actions that should be really 
 803              worked out 
 804          @rtype: list 
 805          """ 
 806          new_actions = [] 
 807          for action in actions: 
 808   
 809              if action in new_actions: # skip dupies 
 810                  continue 
 811   
 812              doaction = action.split() 
 813              if doaction[0] == "slotmove": 
 814   
 815                  # slot move 
 816                  atom = doaction[1] 
 817                  from_slot = doaction[2] 
 818                  to_slot = doaction[3] 
 819                  atom_key = self.entropyTools.dep_getkey(atom) 
 820                  category = atom_key.split("/")[0] 
 821                  matches = self.atomMatch(atom, matchSlot = from_slot, 
 822                      multiMatch = True) 
 823                  found = False 
 824                  # found atoms, check category 
 825                  for idpackage in matches[0]: 
 826                      myslot = self.retrieveSlot(idpackage) 
 827                      mycategory = self.retrieveCategory(idpackage) 
 828                      if mycategory == category: 
 829                          if  (myslot != to_slot) and \ 
 830                          (action not in new_actions): 
 831                              new_actions.append(action) 
 832                              found = True 
 833                              break 
 834                  if found: 
 835                      continue 
 836                  # if we get here it means found == False 
 837                  # search into dependencies 
 838                  dep_atoms = self.searchDependency(atom_key, like = True, 
 839                      multi = True, strings = True) 
 840                  dep_atoms = [x for x in dep_atoms if x.endswith(":"+from_slot) \ 
 841                      and self.entropyTools.dep_getkey(x) == atom_key] 
 842                  if dep_atoms: 
 843                      new_actions.append(action) 
 844   
 845              elif doaction[0] == "move": 
 846                  atom = doaction[1] # usually a key 
 847                  atom_key = self.entropyTools.dep_getkey(atom) 
 848                  category = atom_key.split("/")[0] 
 849                  matches = self.atomMatch(atom, multiMatch = True) 
 850                  found = False 
 851                  for idpackage in matches[0]: 
 852                      mycategory = self.retrieveCategory(idpackage) 
 853                      if (mycategory == category) and (action \ 
 854                          not in new_actions): 
 855                          new_actions.append(action) 
 856                          found = True 
 857                          break 
 858                  if found: 
 859                      continue 
 860                  # if we get here it means found == False 
 861                  # search into dependencies 
 862                  dep_atoms = self.searchDependency(atom_key, like = True, 
 863                      multi = True, strings = True) 
 864                  dep_atoms = [x for x in dep_atoms if \ 
 865                      self.entropyTools.dep_getkey(x) == atom_key] 
 866                  if dep_atoms: 
 867                      new_actions.append(action) 
 868          return new_actions 

 869   

 870 -    def runTreeUpdatesActions(self, actions): 

 871          # this is the place to add extra actions support 
 872          """ 
 873          Method not suited for general purpose usage. 
 874          Executes package name/slot update actions passed. 
 875   
 876          @param actions: list of raw treeupdates actions, for example: 
 877              ['move x11-foo/bar app-foo/bar', 'slotmove x11-foo/bar 2 3'] 
 878          @type actions: list 
 879   
 880          @return: list (set) of packages that should be repackaged 
 881          @rtype: set 
 882          """ 
 883          mytxt = "%s: %s, %s." % ( 
 884              bold(_("SPM")), 
 885              blue(_("Running fixpackages")), 
 886              red(_("it could take a while")), 
 887          ) 
 888          self.updateProgress( 
 889              mytxt, 
 890              importance = 1, 
 891              type = "warning", 
 892              header = darkred(" * ") 
 893          ) 
 894          try: 
 895              spm = get_spm(self) 
 896              spm.run_fixpackages() 
 897          except: 
 898              self.entropyTools.print_traceback() 
 899              pass 
 900   
 901          spm_moves = set() 
 902          quickpkg_atoms = set() 
 903          for action in actions: 
 904              command = action.split() 
 905              mytxt = "%s: %s: %s." % ( 
 906                  bold(_("ENTROPY")), 
 907                  red(_("action")), 
 908                  blue(action), 
 909              ) 
 910              self.updateProgress( 
 911                  mytxt, 
 912                  importance = 1, 
 913                  type = "warning", 
 914                  header = darkred(" * ") 
 915              ) 
 916              if command[0] == "move": 
 917                  spm_moves.add(action) 
 918                  quickpkg_atoms |= self.runTreeUpdatesMoveAction(command[1:], 
 919                      quickpkg_atoms) 
 920              elif command[0] == "slotmove": 
 921                  quickpkg_atoms |= self.runTreeUpdatesSlotmoveAction(command[1:], 
 922                      quickpkg_atoms) 
 923   
 924              mytxt = "%s: %s." % ( 
 925                  bold(_("ENTROPY")), 
 926                  blue(_("package move actions complete")), 
 927              ) 
 928              self.updateProgress( 
 929                  mytxt, 
 930                  importance = 1, 
 931                  type = "info", 
 932                  header = purple(" @@ ") 
 933              ) 
 934   
 935          if spm_moves: 
 936              try: 
 937                  self.doTreeupdatesSpmCleanup(spm_moves) 
 938              except Exception, e: 
 939                  mytxt = "%s: %s: %s, %s." % ( 
 940                      bold(_("WARNING")), 
 941                      red(_("Cannot run SPM cleanup, error")), 
 942                      Exception, 
 943                      e, 
 944                  ) 
 945                  self.entropyTools.print_traceback() 
 946   
 947          mytxt = "%s: %s." % ( 
 948              bold(_("ENTROPY")), 
 949              blue(_("package moves completed successfully")), 
 950          ) 
 951          self.updateProgress( 
 952              mytxt, 
 953              importance = 1, 
 954              type = "info", 
 955              header = brown(" @@ ") 
 956          ) 
 957   
 958          # discard cache 
 959          self.clearCache() 
 960   
 961          return quickpkg_atoms 

 962   
 963   

 964 -    def runTreeUpdatesMoveAction(self, move_command, quickpkg_queue): 

 965          # -- move action: 
 966          # 1) move package key to the new name: category + name + atom 
 967          # 2) update all the dependencies in dependenciesreference to the new key 
 968          # 3) run fixpackages which will update /var/db/pkg files 
 969          # 4) automatically run quickpkg() to build the new binary and 
 970          #    tainted binaries owning tainted iddependency and taint database 
 971          """ 
 972          Method not suited for general purpose usage. 
 973          Executes package name move action passed. 
 974   
 975          @param move_command: raw treeupdates move action, for example: 
 976              'move x11-foo/bar app-foo/bar' 
 977          @type move_command: string 
 978          @param quickpkg_queue: current package regeneration queue 
 979          @type quickpkg_queue: list 
 980          @return: updated package regeneration queue 
 981          @rtype: list 
 982          """ 
 983          dep_from = move_command[0] 
 984          key_from = self.entropyTools.dep_getkey(dep_from) 
 985          key_to = move_command[1] 
 986          cat_to = key_to.split("/")[0] 
 987          name_to = key_to.split("/")[1] 
 988          matches = self.atomMatch(dep_from, multiMatch = True) 
 989          iddependencies = set() 
 990   
 991          for idpackage in matches[0]: 
 992   
 993              slot = self.retrieveSlot(idpackage) 
 994              old_atom = self.retrieveAtom(idpackage) 
 995              new_atom = old_atom.replace(key_from, key_to) 
 996   
 997              ### UPDATE DATABASE 
 998              # update category 
 999              self.setCategory(idpackage, cat_to) 
1000              # update name 
1001              self.setName(idpackage, name_to) 
1002              # update atom 
1003              self.setAtom(idpackage, new_atom) 
1004   
1005              # look for packages we need to quickpkg again 
1006              # note: quickpkg_queue is simply ignored if self.clientDatabase 
1007              quickpkg_queue.add(key_to+":"+str(slot)) 
1008   
1009              if not self.clientDatabase: 
1010   
1011                  # check for injection and warn the developer 
1012                  injected = self.isInjected(idpackage) 
1013                  if injected: 
1014                      mytxt = "%s: %s %s. %s !!! %s." % ( 
1015                          bold(_("INJECT")), 
1016                          blue(str(new_atom)), 
1017                          red(_("has been injected")), 
1018                          red(_("quickpkg manually to update embedded db")), 
1019                          red(_("Repository database updated anyway")), 
1020                      ) 
1021                      self.updateProgress( 
1022                          mytxt, 
1023                          importance = 1, 
1024                          type = "warning", 
1025                          header = darkred(" * ") 
1026                      ) 
1027   
1028          iddeps = self.searchDependency(key_from, like = True, multi = True) 
1029          for iddep in iddeps: 
1030              # update string 
1031              mydep = self.getDependency(iddep) 
1032              mydep_key = self.entropyTools.dep_getkey(mydep) 
1033              # avoid changing wrong atoms -> dev-python/qscintilla-python would 
1034              # become x11-libs/qscintilla if we don't do this check 
1035              if mydep_key != key_from: 
1036                  continue 
1037              mydep = mydep.replace(key_from, key_to) 
1038              # now update 
1039              # dependstable on server is always re-generated 
1040              self.setDependency(iddep, mydep) 
1041              # we have to repackage also package owning this iddep 
1042              iddependencies |= self.searchIdpackageFromIddependency(iddep) 
1043   
1044          self.commitChanges() 
1045          quickpkg_queue = list(quickpkg_queue) 
1046          for x in range(len(quickpkg_queue)): 
1047              myatom = quickpkg_queue[x] 
1048              myatom = myatom.replace(key_from, key_to) 
1049              quickpkg_queue[x] = myatom 
1050          quickpkg_queue = set(quickpkg_queue) 
1051          for idpackage_owner in iddependencies: 
1052              myatom = self.retrieveAtom(idpackage_owner) 
1053              myatom = myatom.replace(key_from, key_to) 
1054              quickpkg_queue.add(myatom) 
1055          return quickpkg_queue 

1056   
1057   

1058 -    def runTreeUpdatesSlotmoveAction(self, slotmove_command, quickpkg_queue): 

1059          # -- slotmove action: 
1060          # 1) move package slot 
1061          # 2) update all the dependencies in dependenciesreference owning 
1062          #    same matched atom + slot 
1063          # 3) run fixpackages which will update /var/db/pkg files 
1064          # 4) automatically run quickpkg() to build the new 
1065          #    binary and tainted binaries owning tainted iddependency 
1066          #    and taint database 
1067          """ 
1068          Method not suited for general purpose usage. 
1069          Executes package slot move action passed. 
1070   
1071          @param slotmove_command: raw treeupdates slot move action, for example: 
1072              'slotmove x11-foo/bar 2 3' 
1073          @type slotmove_command: string 
1074          @param quickpkg_queue: current package regeneration queue 
1075          @type quickpkg_queue: list 
1076          @return: updated package regeneration queue 
1077          @rtype: list 
1078          """ 
1079          atom = slotmove_command[0] 
1080          atomkey = self.entropyTools.dep_getkey(atom) 
1081          slot_from = slotmove_command[1] 
1082          slot_to = slotmove_command[2] 
1083          matches = self.atomMatch(atom, multiMatch = True) 
1084          iddependencies = set() 
1085   
1086          matched_idpackages = matches[0] 
1087          for idpackage in matched_idpackages: 
1088   
1089              ### UPDATE DATABASE 
1090              # update slot 
1091              self.setSlot(idpackage, slot_to) 
1092   
1093              # look for packages we need to quickpkg again 
1094              # note: quickpkg_queue is simply ignored if self.clientDatabase 
1095              quickpkg_queue.add(atom+":"+str(slot_to)) 
1096   
1097              if not self.clientDatabase: 
1098   
1099                  # check for injection and warn the developer 
1100                  injected = self.isInjected(idpackage) 
1101                  if injected: 
1102                      mytxt = "%s: %s %s. %s !!! %s." % ( 
1103                          bold(_("INJECT")), 
1104                          blue(str(atom)), 
1105                          red(_("has been injected")), 
1106                          red(_("quickpkg manually to update embedded db")), 
1107                          red(_("Repository database updated anyway")), 
1108                      ) 
1109                      self.updateProgress( 
1110                          mytxt, 
1111                          importance = 1, 
1112                          type = "warning", 
1113                          header = darkred(" * ") 
1114                      ) 
1115   
1116              # only if we've found VALID matches ! 
1117              iddeps = self.searchDependency(atomkey, like = True, multi = True) 
1118              for iddep in iddeps: 
1119                  # update string 
1120                  mydep = self.getDependency(iddep) 
1121                  mydep_key = self.entropyTools.dep_getkey(mydep) 
1122                  if mydep_key != atomkey: 
1123                      continue 
1124                  if not mydep.endswith(":"+slot_from): # probably slotted dep 
1125                      continue 
1126                  mydep_match = self.atomMatch(mydep) 
1127                  if mydep_match not in matched_idpackages: 
1128                      continue 
1129                  mydep = mydep.replace(":"+slot_from, ":"+slot_to) 
1130                  # now update 
1131                  # dependstable on server is always re-generated 
1132                  self.setDependency(iddep, mydep) 
1133                  # we have to repackage also package owning this iddep 
1134                  iddependencies |= self.searchIdpackageFromIddependency(iddep) 
1135   
1136          self.commitChanges() 
1137          for idpackage_owner in iddependencies: 
1138              myatom = self.retrieveAtom(idpackage_owner) 
1139              quickpkg_queue.add(myatom) 
1140          return quickpkg_queue 

1141   

1142 -    def doTreeupdatesSpmCleanup(self, spm_moves): 

1143          """ 
1144          Erase dead Source Package Manager db entries. 
1145   
1146          @todo: make more Portage independent (create proper entropy.spm 
1147              methods for dealing with this) 
1148          @param spm_moves: list of raw package name/slot update actions. 
1149          @type spm_moves: list 
1150          """ 
1151          # now erase Spm entries if necessary 
1152          for action in spm_moves: 
1153              command = action.split() 
1154              if len(command) < 2: 
1155                  continue 
1156              key = command[1] 
1157              name = key.split("/")[1] 
1158              try: 
1159                  spm = get_spm(self) 
1160              except: 
1161                  self.entropyTools.print_traceback() 
1162                  continue 
1163   
1164              vdb_path = spm.get_vdb_path() 
1165              pkg_path = os.path.join(vdb_path, key.split("/")[0]) 
1166              try: 
1167                  mydirs = [os.path.join(pkg_path, x) for x in \ 
1168                      os.listdir(pkg_path) if x.startswith(name)] 
1169              except OSError: # no dir, no party! 
1170                  continue 
1171              mydirs = [x for x in mydirs if os.path.isdir(x)] 
1172              # now move these dirs 
1173              for mydir in mydirs: 
1174                  to_path = os.path.join(etpConst['packagestmpdir'], 
1175                      os.path.basename(mydir)) 
1176                  mytxt = "%s: %s '%s' %s '%s'" % ( 
1177                      bold(_("SPM")), 
1178                      red(_("Moving old entry")), 
1179                      blue(mydir), 
1180                      red(_("to")), 
1181                      blue(to_path), 
1182                  ) 
1183                  self.updateProgress( 
1184                      mytxt, 
1185                      importance = 1, 
1186                      type = "warning", 
1187                      header = darkred(" * ") 
1188                  ) 
1189                  if os.path.isdir(to_path): 
1190                      shutil.rmtree(to_path, True) 
1191                      try: 
1192                          os.rmdir(to_path) 
1193                      except OSError: 
1194                          pass 
1195                  shutil.move(mydir, to_path) 

1196   
1197   

1198 -    def handlePackage(self, pkg_data, forcedRevision = -1, 
1199          formattedContent = False): 

1200          """ 
1201          Update or add a package to repository automatically handling 
1202          its scope and thus removal of previous versions if requested by 
1203          the given metadata. 
1204          pkg_data is a dict() containing all the information bound to 
1205          a package: 
1206   
1207              { 
1208                  'signatures': 
1209                      { 
1210                          'sha256': u'zzz', 
1211                          'sha1': u'zzz', 
1212                          'sha512': u'zzz' 
1213                   }, 
1214                  'slot': u'0', 
1215                  'datecreation': u'1247681752.93', 
1216                  'description': u'Standard (de)compression library', 
1217                  'useflags': set([u'kernel_linux']), 
1218                  'eclasses': set([u'multilib']), 
1219                  'config_protect_mask': u'string string', 'etpapi': 3, 
1220                  'mirrorlinks': [], 
1221                  'cxxflags': u'-Os -march=x86-64 -pipe', 
1222                  'injected': False, 
1223                  'licensedata': {u'ZLIB': u"lictext"}, 
1224                  'dependencies': {}, 
1225                  'chost': u'x86_64-pc-linux-gnu', 
1226                  'config_protect': u'string string', 
1227                  'download': u'packages/amd64/4/sys-libs:zlib-1.2.3-r1.tbz2', 
1228                  'conflicts': set([]), 
1229                  'digest': u'fd54248ae060c287b1ec939de3e55332', 
1230                  'size': u'136302', 
1231                  'category': u'sys-libs', 
1232                  'license': u'ZLIB', 
1233                  'needed_paths': {}, 
1234                  'sources': set(), 
1235                  'name': u'zlib', 
1236                  'versiontag': u'', 
1237                  'changelog': u"text", 
1238                  'provide': set([]), 
1239                  'trigger': u'text', 
1240                  'counter': 22331, 
1241                  'messages': [], 
1242                  'branch': u'4', 
1243                  'content': {}, 
1244                  'needed': [(u'libc.so.6', 2)], 
1245                  'version': u'1.2.3-r1', 
1246                  'keywords': set(), 
1247                  'cflags': u'-Os -march=x86-64 -pipe', 
1248                  'disksize': 932206, 'spm_phases': None, 
1249                  'homepage': u'http://www.zlib.net/', 
1250                  'systempackage': True, 
1251                  'revision': 0 
1252              } 
1253   
1254          @param pkg_data: Entropy package metadata dict 
1255          @type pkg_data: dict 
1256          @keyword forcedRevision: force a specific package revision 
1257          @type forcedRevision: int 
1258          @keyword formattedContent: tells whether content metadata is already 
1259              formatted for insertion 
1260          @type formattedContent: bool 
1261          @return: tuple composed by 
1262              - idpackage: unique Entropy Repository package identifier 
1263              - revision: final package revision selected 
1264              - pkg_data: new Entropy package metadata dict 
1265          @rtype: tuple 
1266          """ 
1267   
1268          def remove_conflicting_packages(pkgdata): 
1269   
1270              manual_deps = set() 
1271              removelist = self.retrieve_packages_to_remove( 
1272                  pkgdata['name'], pkgdata['category'], 
1273                  pkgdata['slot'], pkgdata['injected'] 
1274              ) 
1275   
1276              for r_idpackage in removelist: 
1277                  manual_deps |= self.retrieveManualDependencies(r_idpackage) 
1278                  self.removePackage(r_idpackage, do_cleanup = False, 
1279                      do_commit = False) 
1280   
1281              # inject old manual dependencies back to package metadata 
1282              for manual_dep in manual_deps: 
1283                  if manual_dep in pkgdata['dependencies']: 
1284                      continue 
1285                  pkgdata['dependencies'][manual_dep] = etpConst['spm']['mdepend_id'] 

1286   
1287   
1288   
1289          if self.clientDatabase: 
1290              remove_conflicting_packages(pkg_data) 
1291              return self.addPackage(pkg_data, revision = forcedRevision, 
1292                  formatted_content = formattedContent) 
1293   
1294          # build atom string, server side 
1295          pkgatom = self.entropyTools.create_package_atom_string( 
1296              pkg_data['category'], pkg_data['name'], pkg_data['version'], 
1297              pkg_data['versiontag']) 
1298   
1299          foundid = self.isAtomAvailable(pkgatom) 
1300          if foundid < 0: # same atom doesn't exist in any branch 
1301              remove_conflicting_packages(pkg_data) 
1302              return self.addPackage(pkg_data, revision = forcedRevision, 
1303                  formatted_content = formattedContent) 
1304   
1305          idpackage = self.getIDPackage(pkgatom) 
1306          curRevision = forcedRevision 
1307          if forcedRevision is -1: 
1308              curRevision = 0 
1309              if idpackage != -1: 
1310                  curRevision = self.retrieveRevision(idpackage) 
1311   
1312          # remove old package atom, we do it here because othersie 
1313          if idpackage != -1: 
1314              # injected packages wouldn't be removed by addPackages 
1315              self.removePackage(idpackage) 
1316              if forcedRevision is -1: 
1317                  curRevision += 1 
1318   
1319          # add the new one 
1320          remove_conflicting_packages(pkg_data) 
1321          return self.addPackage(pkg_data, revision = curRevision, 
1322              formatted_content = formattedContent) 

1323   

1324 -    def retrieve_packages_to_remove(self, name, category, slot, injected): 

1325          """ 
1326          Return a list of packages that would be removed given name, category, 
1327          slot and injection status. 
1328   
1329          @param name: package name 
1330          @type name: string 
1331          @param category: package category 
1332          @type category: string 
1333          @param slot: package slot 
1334          @type slot: string 
1335          @param injected: injection status (packages marked as injected are 
1336              always considered not automatically removable) 
1337          @type injected: bool 
1338   
1339          @return: list (set) of removable packages (idpackages) 
1340          @rtype: set 
1341          """ 
1342   
1343          removelist = set() 
1344          if injected: 
1345              # read: if package has been injected, we'll skip 
1346              # the removal of packages in the same slot, 
1347              # usually used server side btw 
1348              return removelist 
1349   
1350          # support for expiration-based packages handling, also internally 
1351          # called Fat Scope. 
1352          filter_similar = False 
1353          srv_ss_plg = etpConst['system_settings_plugins_ids']['server_plugin'] 
1354          srv_ss_fs_plg = \ 
1355              etpConst['system_settings_plugins_ids']['server_plugin_fatscope'] 
1356   
1357          if not self.clientDatabase: # server-side db 
1358              srv_plug_settings = self.SystemSettings.get(srv_ss_plg) 
1359              if srv_plug_settings != None: 
1360                  if srv_plug_settings['server']['exp_based_scope']: 
1361                      # in case support is enabled, return an empty set 
1362                      filter_similar = True 
1363   
1364          searchsimilar = self.searchPackagesByNameAndCategory( 
1365              name = name, 
1366              category = category, 
1367              sensitive = True 
1368          ) 
1369          if filter_similar: 
1370              # filter out packages in the same scope that are allowed to stay 
1371              idpkgs = self.SystemSettings[srv_ss_fs_plg]['repos'].get( 
1372                  self.server_repo) 
1373              if idpkgs: 
1374                  if -1 in idpkgs: 
1375                      del searchsimilar[:] 
1376                  else: 
1377                      searchsimilar = [x for x in searchsimilar if x[1] \ 
1378                          not in idpkgs] 
1379   
1380          for atom, idpackage in searchsimilar: 
1381              # get the package slot 
1382              myslot = self.retrieveSlot(idpackage) 
1383              # we merely ignore packages with 
1384              # negative counters, since they're the injected ones 
1385              if self.isInjected(idpackage): continue 
1386              if slot == myslot: 
1387                  # remove! 
1388                  removelist.add(idpackage) 
1389   
1390          return removelist 

1391   

1392 -    def addPackage(self, pkg_data, revision = -1, idpackage = None, 
1393          do_commit = True, formatted_content = False): 

1394          """ 
1395          Add package to this Entropy repository. The main difference between 
1396          handlePackage and this is that from here, no packages are going to be 
1397          removed, in any case. 
1398          For more information about pkg_data layout, please see 
1399          I{handlePackage()}. 
1400   
1401          @param pkg_data: Entropy package metadata 
1402          @type pkg_data: dict 
1403          @keyword revision: force a specific Entropy package revision 
1404          @type revision: int 
1405          @keyword idpackage: add package to Entropy repository using the 
1406              provided package identifier, this is very dangerous and could 
1407              cause packages with the same identifier to be removed. 
1408          @type idpackage: int 
1409          @keyword do_commit: if True, automatically commits the executed 
1410              transaction (could cause slowness) 
1411          @type do_commit: bool 
1412          @keyword formatted_content: if True, determines whether the content 
1413              metadata (usually the biggest part) in pkg_data is already 
1414              prepared for insertion 
1415          @type formatted_content: bool 
1416          @return: tuple composed by 
1417              - idpackage: unique Entropy Repository package identifier 
1418              - revision: final package revision selected 
1419              - pkg_data: new Entropy package metadata dict 
1420          @rtype: tuple 
1421          """ 
1422          if revision is -1: 
1423              try: 
1424                  revision = int(pkg_data['revision']) 
1425              except (KeyError, ValueError): 
1426                  pkg_data['revision'] = 0 # revision not specified 
1427                  revision = 0 
1428          elif not pkg_data.has_key('revision'): 
1429              pkg_data['revision'] = revision 
1430   
1431          # create new category if it doesn't exist 
1432          catid = self.isCategoryAvailable(pkg_data['category']) 
1433          if catid is -1: catid = self.addCategory(pkg_data['category']) 
1434   
1435          # create new license if it doesn't exist 
1436          licid = self.isLicenseAvailable(pkg_data['license']) 
1437          if licid is -1: licid = self.addLicense(pkg_data['license']) 
1438   
1439          idprotect = self.isProtectAvailable(pkg_data['config_protect']) 
1440          if idprotect is -1: idprotect = self.addProtect( 
1441              pkg_data['config_protect']) 
1442   
1443          idprotect_mask = self.isProtectAvailable( 
1444              pkg_data['config_protect_mask']) 
1445          if idprotect_mask is -1: idprotect_mask = self.addProtect( 
1446              pkg_data['config_protect_mask']) 
1447   
1448          idflags = self.areCompileFlagsAvailable( 
1449              pkg_data['chost'],pkg_data['cflags'],pkg_data['cxxflags']) 
1450          if idflags is -1: idflags = self.addCompileFlags( 
1451              pkg_data['chost'],pkg_data['cflags'],pkg_data['cxxflags']) 
1452   
1453          trigger = 0 
1454          if pkg_data['trigger']: 
1455              trigger = 1 
1456   
1457          # baseinfo 
1458          pkgatom = self.entropyTools.create_package_atom_string( 
1459              pkg_data['category'], pkg_data['name'], pkg_data['version'], 
1460              pkg_data['versiontag']) 
1461          # add atom metadatum 
1462          pkg_data['atom'] = pkgatom 
1463   
1464          mybaseinfo_data = (pkgatom, catid, pkg_data['name'], pkg_data['version'], 
1465              pkg_data['versiontag'], revision, pkg_data['branch'], pkg_data['slot'], 
1466              licid, pkg_data['etpapi'], trigger,) 
1467   
1468          myidpackage_string = 'NULL' 
1469          if isinstance(idpackage, (int, long,)): 
1470   
1471              manual_deps = self.retrieveManualDependencies(idpackage) 
1472   
1473              # does it exist? 
1474              self.removePackage(idpackage, do_cleanup = False, 
1475                  do_commit = False, do_rss = False) 
1476              myidpackage_string = '?' 
1477              mybaseinfo_data = (idpackage,)+mybaseinfo_data 
1478   
1479              # merge old manual dependencies 
1480              dep_dict = pkg_data['dependencies'] 
1481              for manual_dep in manual_deps: 
1482                  if manual_dep in dep_dict: 
1483                      continue 
1484                  dep_dict[manual_dep] = etpConst['spm']['mdepend_id'] 
1485   
1486          else: 
1487              # force to None 
1488              idpackage = None 
1489   
1490   
1491          with self.__write_mutex: 
1492   
1493              cur = self.cursor.execute(""" 
1494              INSERT INTO baseinfo VALUES (%s,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?)""" % ( 
1495                  myidpackage_string,), mybaseinfo_data) 
1496              if idpackage is None: 
1497                  idpackage = cur.lastrowid 
1498   
1499              # extrainfo 
1500              self.cursor.execute( 
1501                  'INSERT INTO extrainfo VALUES (?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?)', 
1502                  (   idpackage, 
1503                      pkg_data['description'], 
1504                      pkg_data['homepage'], 
1505                      pkg_data['download'], 
1506                      pkg_data['size'], 
1507                      idflags, 
1508                      pkg_data['digest'], 
1509                      pkg_data['datecreation'], 
1510                  ) 
1511              ) 
1512          ### other information iserted below are not as critical as these above 
1513   
1514          # tables using a select 
1515          self.insertEclasses(idpackage, pkg_data['eclasses']) 
1516          self.insertNeeded(idpackage, pkg_data['needed']) 
1517          self.insertDependencies(idpackage, pkg_data['dependencies']) 
1518          self.insertSources(idpackage, pkg_data['sources']) 
1519          self.insertUseflags(idpackage, pkg_data['useflags']) 
1520          self.insertKeywords(idpackage, pkg_data['keywords']) 
1521          self.insertLicenses(pkg_data['licensedata']) 
1522          self.insertMirrors(pkg_data['mirrorlinks']) 
1523          # package ChangeLog 
1524          if pkg_data.get('changelog'): 
1525              self.insertChangelog(pkg_data['category'], pkg_data['name'], 
1526                  pkg_data['changelog']) 
1527          # package signatures 
1528          if pkg_data.get('signatures'): 
1529              signatures = pkg_data['signatures'] 
1530              sha1, sha256, sha512 = signatures['sha1'], signatures['sha256'], \ 
1531                  signatures['sha512'] 
1532              self.insertSignatures(idpackage, sha1, sha256, sha512) 
1533          # needed libraries paths 
1534          if pkg_data.get('needed_paths'): 
1535              for lib in sorted(pkg_data['needed_paths']): 
1536                  self.insertNeededPaths(lib, pkg_data['needed_paths'][lib]) 
1537   
1538          # spm phases 
1539          if pkg_data.get('spm_phases') != None: 
1540              self.insertSpmPhases(idpackage, pkg_data['spm_phases']) 
1541   
1542          # not depending on other tables == no select done 
1543          self.insertContent(idpackage, pkg_data['content'], 
1544              already_formatted = formatted_content) 
1545   
1546          # handle SPM UID<->idpackage binding 
1547          pkg_data['counter'] = int(pkg_data['counter']) 
1548          if not pkg_data['injected'] and (pkg_data['counter'] is not -1): 
1549              pkg_data['counter'] = self.bindSpmPackageUid( 
1550                  idpackage, pkg_data['counter'], pkg_data['branch']) 
1551   
1552          self.insertOnDiskSize(idpackage, pkg_data['disksize']) 
1553          if pkg_data['trigger']: 
1554              self.insertTrigger(idpackage, pkg_data['trigger']) 
1555          self.insertConflicts(idpackage, pkg_data['conflicts']) 
1556          self.insertProvide(idpackage, pkg_data['provide']) 
1557          self.insertMessages(idpackage, pkg_data['messages']) 
1558          self.insertConfigProtect(idpackage, idprotect) 
1559          self.insertConfigProtect(idpackage, idprotect_mask, mask = True) 
1560          # injected? 
1561          if pkg_data.get('injected'): 
1562              self.setInjected(idpackage, do_commit = False) 
1563          # is it a system package? 
1564          if pkg_data.get('systempackage'): 
1565              self.setSystemPackage(idpackage, do_commit = False) 
1566   
1567          self.clearCache() # we do live_cache.clear() here too 
1568          if do_commit: 
1569              self.commitChanges() 
1570   
1571          ### RSS Atom support 
1572          ### dictionary will be elaborated by activator 
1573          if self.SystemSettings.has_key(self.srv_sys_settings_plugin): 
1574              if self.SystemSettings[self.srv_sys_settings_plugin]['server']['rss']['enabled'] and \ 
1575                  not self.clientDatabase: 
1576   
1577                  self._write_rss_for_added_package(pkgatom, revision, 
1578                      pkg_data['description'], pkg_data['homepage']) 
1579   
1580          # Update category description 
1581          if not self.clientDatabase: 
1582              mycategory = pkg_data['category'] 
1583              descdata = {} 
1584              try: 
1585                  descdata = self._get_category_description_from_disk(mycategory) 
1586              except (IOError, OSError, EOFError,): 
1587                  pass 
1588              if descdata: 
1589                  self.setCategoryDescription(mycategory, descdata) 
1590   
1591          return idpackage, revision, pkg_data 

1592   

1593 -    def _write_rss_for_added_package(self, pkgatom, revision, description, 
1594          homepage): 

1595   
1596          # setup variables we're going to use 
1597          srv_repo = self.server_repo 
1598          rss_atom = "%s~%s" % (pkgatom, revision,) 
1599          status = ServerRepositoryStatus() 
1600          srv_updates = status.get_updates_log(srv_repo) 
1601          rss_name = srv_repo + etpConst['rss-dump-name'] 
1602   
1603          # load metadata from on disk cache, if available 
1604          rss_obj = self.dumpTools.loadobj(rss_name) 
1605          if rss_obj: 
1606              srv_updates.update(rss_obj) 
1607   
1608          # setup metadata keys, if not available 
1609          if not srv_updates.has_key('added'): 
1610              srv_updates['added'] = {} 
1611          if not srv_updates.has_key('removed'): 
1612              srv_updates['removed'] = {} 
1613          if not srv_updates.has_key('light'): 
1614              srv_updates['light'] = {} 
1615   
1616          # if pkgatom (rss_atom) is in the "removed" metadata, drop it 
1617          if rss_atom in srv_updates['removed']: 
1618              del srv_updates['removed'][rss_atom] 
1619   
1620          # add metadata 
1621          srv_updates['added'][rss_atom] = {} 
1622          srv_updates['added'][rss_atom]['description'] = description 
1623          srv_updates['added'][rss_atom]['homepage'] = homepage 
1624          srv_updates['light'][rss_atom] = {} 
1625          srv_updates['light'][rss_atom]['description'] = description 
1626   
1627          # save to disk 
1628          self.dumpTools.dumpobj(rss_name, srv_updates) 

1629   

1630 -    def _write_rss_for_removed_package(self, idpackage): 

1631          """ 
1632          docstring_title 
1633   
1634          @param idpackage: package indentifier 
1635          @type idpackage: int 
1636          @return: 
1637          @rtype: 
1638   
1639          """ 
1640   
1641          # setup variables we're going to use 
1642          srv_repo = self.server_repo 
1643          rss_revision = self.retrieveRevision(idpackage) 
1644          rss_atom = "%s~%s" % (self.retrieveAtom(idpackage), rss_revision,) 
1645          status = ServerRepositoryStatus() 
1646          srv_updates = status.get_updates_log(srv_repo) 
1647          rss_name = srv_repo + etpConst['rss-dump-name'] 
1648   
1649          # load metadata from on disk cache, if available 
1650          rss_obj = self.dumpTools.loadobj(rss_name) 
1651          if rss_obj: 
1652              srv_updates.update(rss_obj) 
1653   
1654          # setup metadata keys, if not available 
1655          if not srv_updates.has_key('added'): 
1656              srv_updates['added'] = {} 
1657          if not srv_updates.has_key('removed'): 
1658              srv_updates['removed'] = {} 
1659          if not srv_updates.has_key('light'): 
1660              srv_updates['light'] = {} 
1661   
1662          # if pkgatom (rss_atom) is in the "added" metadata, drop it 
1663          if rss_atom in srv_updates['added']: 
1664              del srv_updates['added'][rss_atom] 
1665          # same thing for light key 
1666          if rss_atom in srv_updates['light']: 
1667              del srv_updates['light'][rss_atom] 
1668   
1669          # add metadata 
1670          mydict = {} 
1671          try: 
1672              mydict['description'] = self.retrieveDescription(idpackage) 
1673          except TypeError: 
1674              mydict['description'] = "N/A" 
1675          try: 
1676              mydict['homepage'] = self.retrieveHomepage(idpackage) 
1677          except TypeError: 
1678              mydict['homepage'] = "" 
1679          srv_updates['removed'][rss_atom] = mydict 
1680   
1681          # save to disk 
1682          self.dumpTools.dumpobj(rss_name, srv_updates)

1684 -    def removePackage(self, idpackage, do_cleanup = True, do_commit = True, 
1685          do_rss = True): 

1686          """ 
1687          Remove package from this Entropy repository using it's identifier 
1688          (idpackage). 
1689   
1690          @param idpackage: Entropy repository package indentifier 
1691          @type idpackage: int 
1692          @keyword do_cleanup: if True, executes repository metadata cleanup 
1693              at the end 
1694          @type do_cleanup: bool 
1695          @keyword do_commit: if True, commits the transaction (could cause 
1696              slowness) 
1697          @type do_commit: bool 
1698          @keyword do_rss: triggered only for server-side repositories, if True, 
1699              generates information about the removal in RSS form, dumping data 
1700              to cache (used internally to handle RSS support for repositories). 
1701          @type do_rss: bool 
1702          """ 
1703          # clear caches 
1704          self.clearCache() 
1705   
1706          ### RSS Atom support 
1707          ### dictionary will be elaborated by activator 
1708          if self.SystemSettings.has_key(self.srv_sys_settings_plugin): 
1709              if self.SystemSettings[self.srv_sys_settings_plugin]['server']['rss']['enabled'] and \ 
1710                  (not self.clientDatabase) and do_rss: 
1711   
1712                  # store addPackage action 
1713                  self._write_rss_for_removed_package(idpackage) 
1714   
1715          with self.__write_mutex: 
1716   
1717              r_tup = (idpackage,)*20 
1718              self.cursor.executescript(""" 
1719                  DELETE FROM baseinfo WHERE idpackage = %d; 
1720                  DELETE FROM extrainfo WHERE idpackage = %d; 
1721                  DELETE FROM dependencies WHERE idpackage = %d; 
1722                  DELETE FROM provide WHERE idpackage = %d; 
1723                  DELETE FROM conflicts WHERE idpackage = %d; 
1724                  DELETE FROM configprotect WHERE idpackage = %d; 
1725                  DELETE FROM configprotectmask WHERE idpackage = %d; 
1726                  DELETE FROM sources WHERE idpackage = %d; 
1727                  DELETE FROM useflags WHERE idpackage = %d; 
1728                  DELETE FROM keywords WHERE idpackage = %d; 
1729                  DELETE FROM content WHERE idpackage = %d; 
1730                  DELETE FROM messages WHERE idpackage = %d; 
1731                  DELETE FROM counters WHERE idpackage = %d; 
1732                  DELETE FROM sizes WHERE idpackage = %d; 
1733                  DELETE FROM eclasses WHERE idpackage = %d; 
1734                  DELETE FROM needed WHERE idpackage = %d; 
1735                  DELETE FROM triggers WHERE idpackage = %d; 
1736                  DELETE FROM systempackages WHERE idpackage = %d; 
1737                  DELETE FROM injected WHERE idpackage = %d; 
1738                  DELETE FROM installedtable WHERE idpackage = %d; 
1739              """ % r_tup) 
1740   
1741          # FIXME: move these inside the main SQL script above 
1742          try: 
1743              self.removeAutomergefiles(idpackage) 
1744          except self.dbapi2.OperationalError: 
1745              pass 
1746          try: 
1747              self.removeSignatures(idpackage) 
1748          except self.dbapi2.OperationalError: 
1749              pass 
1750          try: 
1751              self.removeSpmPhases(idpackage) 
1752          except self.dbapi2.OperationalError: 
1753              pass 
1754   
1755          # Remove from dependstable if exists 
1756          self.removePackageFromDependsTable(idpackage) 
1757   
1758          if do_cleanup: 
1759              # Cleanups if at least one package has been removed 
1760              self.doCleanups() 
1761   
1762          if do_commit: 
1763              self.commitChanges()

1771          @type mirrorname: string

1778 -    def addMirrors(self, mirrorname, mirrorlist): 

1779          """ 
1780          Add source package mirror entry to database. 
1781          This is a representation of Portage's "thirdpartymirrors". 
1782

1784          @type mirrorname: string

1786          @type mirrorlist: list 
1787          """ 
1788          with self.__write_mutex: 
1789              self.cursor.executemany(""" 
1790              INSERT into mirrorlinks VALUES (?,?) 
1791              """, [(mirrorname, x,) for x in mirrorlist])

1959 -    def setSystemPackage(self, idpackage, do_commit = True): 

1960          """

1962          will deny its removal. 
1963

1965          @type idpackage: int 
1966          @keyword do_commit: determine whether executing commit or not 
1967          @type do_commit: bool 
1968          """ 
1969          with self.__write_mutex: 
1970              self.cursor.execute(""" 
1971              INSERT into systempackages VALUES (?) 
1972              """, (idpackage,)) 
1973              if do_commit: 
1974                  self.commitChanges()

1976 -    def setInjected(self, idpackage, do_commit = True): 

1977          """ 
1978          Mark package as injected, injection is usually set for packages 
1979          manually added to repository. Injected packages are not removed 
1980          automatically even when featuring conflicting scope with other 
1981          that are being added. If a package is injected, it means that 
1982          maintainers have to handle it manually. 
1983   
1984          @param idpackage: package indentifier 
1985          @type idpackage: int 
1986          @keyword do_commit: determine whether executing commit or not 
1987          @type do_commit: bool 
1988          """ 
1989          with self.__write_mutex: 
1990              if not self.isInjected(idpackage): 
1991                  self.cursor.execute(""" 
1992                  INSERT into injected VALUES (?) 
1993                  """, (idpackage,)) 
1994              if do_commit: 
1995                  self.commitChanges() 

1996   

1997 -    def setCreationDate(self, idpackage, date): 

1998          """ 
1999          Update the creation date for package. Creation date is stored in 
2000          string based unix time format. 
2001   
2002          @param idpackage: package indentifier 
2003          @type idpackage: int 
2004          @param date: unix time in string form 
2005          @type date: string 
2006          """ 
2007          with self.__write_mutex: 
2008              self.cursor.execute(""" 
2009              UPDATE extrainfo SET datecreation = (?) WHERE idpackage = (?) 
2010              """, (str(date), idpackage,)) 
2011              self.commitChanges()

2044              UPDATE packagesignatures SET sha1 = (?), sha256 = (?), sha512 = (?)

2214                  return 0

2261

2263          @type idpackage: int

2269          @keyword already_formatted: if True, "content" is expected to be 
2270              already formatted for insertion, this means that "content" must be 
2271              a list of tuples of length 3. 
2272          @type already_formatted: bool 
2273          """ 
2274   
2275          with self.__write_mutex: 
2276   
2277              if already_formatted: 
2278                  self.cursor.executemany(""" 
2279                  INSERT INTO content VALUES (?,?,?) 
2280                  """, [(idpackage, x, y,) for a, x, y in content]) 
2281              else: 
2282                  self.cursor.executemany(""" 
2283                  INSERT INTO content VALUES (?,?,?) 
2284                  """, [(idpackage, x, content[x],) for x in content])

2335 -    def removeSignatures(self, idpackage): 

2336          """ 
2337          Remove extra package file hashes (SHA1, SHA256, SHA512) for package. 
2338          Entropy package files metadata contains up to 4 hashes: 
2339              md5, sha1, sha256, sha512 
2340          While md5 is here for historical reasons (being the first supported) 
2341          sha1, sha256, sha512 have been added recently and located into a 
2342          separate database table called "packagesignatures". Such hashes 
2343          can be not available for older packages, so don't be scared, aliens 
2344          are not to blame. 
2345   
2346          @param idpackage: package indentifier 
2347          @type idpackage: int 
2348          """ 
2349          with self.__write_mutex: 
2350              self.cursor.execute(""" 
2351              DELETE FROM packagesignatures WHERE idpackage = (?) 
2352              """, (idpackage,))

2439 -    def insertConfigProtect(self, idpackage, idprotect, mask = False): 

2440          """ 
2441          Insert CONFIG_PROTECT (configuration files protection) entry identifier 
2442          for package. This entry is usually a space separated string of directory 
2443          and files which are used to handle user-protected configuration files 
2444          or directories, those that are going to be stashed in separate paths 
2445          waiting for user merge decisions. 
2446   
2447          @param idpackage: package indentifier 
2448          @type idpackage: int 
2449          @param idprotect: configuration files protection identifier 
2450          @type idprotect: int 
2451          @keyword mask: if True, idproctect will be considered a "mask" entry, 
2452              meaning that configuration files starting with paths referenced 
2453              by idprotect will be forcefully merged. 
2454          @type mask: bool 
2455          """ 
2456   
2457          mytable = 'configprotect' 
2458          if mask: 
2459              mytable += 'mask' 
2460          with self.__write_mutex: 
2461              self.cursor.execute(""" 
2462              INSERT into %s VALUES (?,?) 
2463              """ % (mytable,), (idpackage, idprotect,))

2465 -    def insertMirrors(self, mirrors): 

2466          """

2468          The term "mirror" in this case references to Source Package Manager 
2469          package download mirrors.

2471          future. 
2472

2474          @param mirrors: list of tuples of length 2 containing string as first

2478          """

2481              # remove old 
2482              self.removeMirrorEntries(mirrorname) 
2483              # add new 
2484              self.addMirrors(mirrorname, mirrorlist)

2719 -    def insertBranchMigration(self, repository, from_branch, to_branch,

2721          """ 
2722          Insert Entropy Client "branch migration" scripts hash metadata. 
2723          When upgrading from a branch to another, it can happen that repositories 
2724          ship with scripts aiming to ease the upgrade. 
2725          This method stores in the repository information on such scripts. 
2726

2735          @type post_migration_md5sum: string 
2736          @param post_upgrade_md5sum: md5 hash related to "post-upgrade on new 
2737              branch" script file 
2738          @type post_upgrade_md5sum: string 
2739          """ 
2740          with self.__write_mutex: 
2741              self.cursor.execute(""" 
2742              INSERT OR REPLACE INTO entropy_branch_migration VALUES (?,?,?,?,?) 
2743              """, ( 
2744                      repository, from_branch, 
2745                      to_branch, post_migration_md5sum, 
2746                      post_upgrade_md5sum, 
2747                  ) 
2748              ) 

2749   

2750 -    def setBranchMigrationPostUpgradeMd5sum(self, repository, from_branch, 
2751          to_branch, post_upgrade_md5sum): 

2752          """ 
2753          Update "post-upgrade on new branch" script file md5 hash. 
2754          When upgrading from a branch to another, it can happen that repositories 
2755          ship with scripts aiming to ease the upgrade. 
2756          This method stores in the repository information on such scripts. 
2757   
2758          @param repository: repository identifier 
2759          @type repository: string 
2760          @param from_branch: original branch 
2761          @type from_branch: string 
2762          @param to_branch: destination branch 
2763          @type to_branch: string 
2764          @param post_upgrade_md5sum: md5 hash related to "post-upgrade on new 
2765              branch" script file 
2766          @type post_upgrade_md5sum: string 
2767          """ 
2768          with self.__write_mutex: 
2769              self.cursor.execute(""" 
2770              UPDATE entropy_branch_migration SET post_upgrade_md5sum = (?) WHERE 
2771              repository = (?) AND from_branch = (?) AND to_branch = (?) 
2772              """, (post_upgrade_md5sum, repository, from_branch, to_branch,))

2774   

2775 -    def bindSpmPackageUid(self, idpackage, spm_package_uid, branch): 

2776          """ 
2777          Bind Source Package Manager package identifier ("COUNTER" metadata 
2778          for Portage) to Entropy package. 
2779          If uid <= -2, a new negative UID will be allocated and returned. 
2780          Negative UIDs are considered auto-allocated by Entropy. 
2781          This is mainly used for binary packages not belonging to any SPM 
2782          packages which are just "injected" inside the repository. 
2783   
2784          @param idpackage: package indentifier 
2785          @type idpackage: int 
2786          @param spm_package_uid: Source package Manager unique package identifier 
2787          @type spm_package_uid: int 
2788          @param branch: current running Entropy branch 
2789          @type branch: string 
2790          @return: uid set 
2791          @rtype: int 
2792          """ 
2793   
2794          my_uid = spm_package_uid 
2795   
2796          if my_uid <= -2: 
2797              # special cases 
2798              my_uid = self.getNewNegativeSpmUid() 
2799   
2800          with self.__write_mutex: 
2801              try: 
2802                  self.cursor.execute('INSERT into counters VALUES (?,?,?)', 
2803                      (my_uid, idpackage, branch,)) 
2804              except self.dbapi2.IntegrityError: 
2805                  # we have a PRIMARY KEY we need to remove 
2806                  self._migrateCountersTable() 
2807                  self.cursor.execute('INSERT into counters VALUES (?,?,?)', 
2808                      (my_uid, idpackage, branch,)) 
2809              except: 
2810                  if self.dbname == etpConst['clientdbid']: 
2811                      # force only for client database 
2812                      if self.doesTableExist("counters"): 
2813                          raise 
2814                      self.cursor.execute( 
2815                      'INSERT into counters VALUES (?,?,?)', 
2816                          (my_uid, idpackage, branch,)) 
2817                  elif self.dbname.startswith(etpConst['serverdbid']): 
2818                      raise 
2819   
2820          return my_uid 

2821   

2822 -    def insertSpmUid(self, idpackage, spm_package_uid, branch = None): 

2823          """ 
2824          Insert Source Package Manager unique package identifier and bind it 
2825          to Entropy package identifier given (idpackage). This method is used 
2826          by Entropy Client and differs from "bindSpmPackageUid" because 
2827          any other colliding idpackage<->uid binding is overwritten by design. 
2828   
2829          @param idpackage: package indentifier 
2830          @type idpackage: int 
2831          @param spm_package_uid: Source package Manager unique package identifier 
2832          @type spm_package_uid: int 
2833          @param branch: current running Entropy branch 
2834          @type branch: string 
2835          """ 
2836          if not branch: 
2837              branch = self.db_branch 
2838          if not branch: 
2839              branch = self.SystemSettings['repositories']['branch'] 
2840   
2841          with self.__write_mutex: 
2842   
2843              self.cursor.execute(""" 
2844              DELETE FROM counters WHERE (counter = (?) OR 
2845              idpackage = (?)) AND branch = (?); 
2846              """, (spm_package_uid, idpackage, branch,)) 
2847              self.cursor.execute(""" 
2848              INSERT INTO counters VALUES (?,?,?); 
2849              """, (spm_package_uid, idpackage, branch,)) 
2850   
2851              self.commitChanges() 

2852   

2853 -    def setTrashedUid(self, spm_package_uid): 

2854          """ 
2855          Mark given Source Package Manager unique package identifier as 
2856          "trashed". This is a trick to allow Entropy Server to support 
2857          multiple repositories and parallel handling of them without 
2858          make it messing with removed packages from the underlying system. 
2859   
2860          @param spm_package_uid: Source package Manager unique package identifier 
2861          @type spm_package_uid: int 
2862          """ 
2863          with self.__write_mutex: 
2864              self.cursor.execute(""" 
2865              INSERT OR REPLACE INTO trashedcounters VALUES (?) 
2866              """, (spm_package_uid,)) 

2867   

2868 -    def setSpmUid(self, idpackage, spm_package_uid, branch = None): 

2869          """ 
2870          Update Source Package Manager unique package identifier for given 
2871          Entropy package identifier (idpackage). 
2872          This method *only* updates a currently available binding setting a new 
2873          "spm_package_uid" 
2874   
2875          @param idpackage: package indentifier 
2876          @type idpackage: int 
2877          @param spm_package_uid: Source package Manager unique package identifier 
2878          @type spm_package_uid: int 
2879          @keyword branch: current Entropy repository branch 
2880          @type branch: string 
2881          """ 
2882          branchstring = '' 
2883          insertdata = [spm_package_uid, idpackage] 
2884          if branch: 
2885              branchstring = ', branch = (?)' 
2886              insertdata.insert(1, branch) 
2887   
2888          with self.__write_mutex: 
2889              try: 
2890                  self.cursor.execute(""" 
2891                  UPDATE counters SET counter = (?) %s 
2892                  WHERE idpackage = (?)""" % (branchstring,), insertdata) 
2893              except self.dbapi2.Error: 
2894                  if self.dbname == etpConst['clientdbid']: 
2895                      raise 
2896              self.commitChanges()
