2898 -    def contentDiff(self, idpackage, dbconn, dbconn_idpackage): 

2899          """ 
2900          Return content metadata difference between two packages. 
2901   
2902          @param idpackage: package indentifier available in this repository 
2903          @type idpackage: int 
2904          @param dbconn: other repository class instance 
2905          @type dbconn: EntropyRepository 
2906          @param dbconn_idpackage: package identifier available in other 
2907              repository 
2908          @type dbconn_idpackage: int 
2909          @return: content difference 
2910          @rtype: set 
2911          @raise AttributeError: when self instance and dbconn are the same 
2912          """ 
2913   
2914          if self is dbconn: 
2915              raise AttributeError("cannot diff inside the same db") 
2916   
2917          self.connection.text_factory = \ 
2918              lambda x: unicode(x, "raw_unicode_escape") 
2919   
2920          # setup random table name 
2921          randomtable = "cdiff%s" % (self.entropyTools.get_random_number(),) 
2922          while self.doesTableExist(randomtable): 
2923              randomtable = "cdiff%s" % (self.entropyTools.get_random_number(),) 
2924   
2925          # create random table 
2926          self.cursor.execute(""" 
2927              CREATE TEMPORARY TABLE %s ( file VARCHAR )""" % (randomtable,) 
2928          ) 
2929   
2930          try: 
2931              dbconn.connection.text_factory = \ 
2932                  lambda x: unicode(x, "raw_unicode_escape") 
2933   
2934              cur = dbconn.cursor.execute(""" 
2935              SELECT file FROM content WHERE idpackage = (?) 
2936              """, (dbconn_idpackage,)) 
2937              self.cursor.executemany(""" 
2938              INSERT INTO %s VALUES (?)""" % (randomtable,), cur) 
2939   
2940              # now compare 
2941              cur = self.cursor.execute(""" 
2942              SELECT file FROM content  
2943              WHERE content.idpackage = (?) AND  
2944              content.file NOT IN (SELECT file from %s)""" % (randomtable,), 
2945                  (idpackage,)) 
2946   
2947              # suck back 
2948              return self._fetchall2set(cur.fetchall()) 
2949   
2950          finally: 
2951              self.cursor.execute('DROP TABLE IF EXISTS %s' % (randomtable,)) 

2952

3033 -    def getNewNegativeSpmUid(self): 

3034          """ 
3035          Obtain auto-generated available negative Source Package Manager 
3036          package identifier. 
3037   
3038          @return: new negative spm uid 
3039          @rtype: int 
3040          """ 
3041          try: 
3042              cur = self.cursor.execute('SELECT min(counter) FROM counters') 
3043              dbcounter = cur.fetchone() 
3044              mycounter = 0 
3045              if dbcounter: 
3046                  mycounter = dbcounter[0] 
3047   
3048              if mycounter >= -1 or mycounter is None: 
3049                  counter = -2 
3050              else: 
3051                  counter = mycounter-1 
3052   
3053          except self.dbapi2.Error: 
3054              counter = -2 # first available counter 
3055   
3056          return counter 

3057   

3058 -    def getApi(self):

3061   
3062          @return: Entropy repository API 
3063          @rtype: int 
3064          """ 
3065          cur = self.cursor.execute('SELECT max(etpapi) FROM baseinfo') 
3066          api = cur.fetchone() 
3067          if api: 
3068              return api[0] 
3069          return -1

3332 -    def getTriggerInfo(self, idpackage, content = True): 

3333          """ 
3334          Get a set of basic package metadata for provided package identifier. 
3335          This method is optimized to work with Entropy Client installation 
3336          triggers returning only what is strictly needed. 
3337   
3338          @param idpackage: package indentifier 
3339          @type idpackage: int 
3340          @keyword content: if True, grabs the "content" metadata too, othewise 
3341              such dict key value will be shown as empty set(). 
3342          @type content: bool 
3343          @return: dictionary containing package metadata 
3344   
3345              data = { 
3346                  'atom': atom, 
3347                  'category': category, 
3348                  'name': name, 
3349                  'version': version, 
3350                  'versiontag': versiontag, 
3351                  'revision': revision, 
3352                  'branch': branch, 
3353                  'chost': chost, 
3354                  'cflags': cflags, 
3355                  'cxxflags': cxxflags, 
3356                  'etpapi': etpapi, 
3357                  'trigger': self.retrieveTrigger(idpackage), 
3358                  'eclasses': self.retrieveEclasses(idpackage), 
3359                  'content': pkg_content, 
3360                  'spm_phases': self.retrieveSpmPhases(idpackage), 
3361              }

3364          """

3367          version, slot, versiontag, \ 
3368          revision, branch, etpapi = self.getScopeData(idpackage) 
3369          chost, cflags, cxxflags = self.retrieveCompileFlags(idpackage)

3372          if content: 
3373              pkg_content = self.retrieveContent(idpackage) 
3374   
3375          data = { 
3376              'atom': atom, 
3377              'category': category, 
3378              'name': name, 
3379              'version': version, 
3380              'versiontag': versiontag, 
3381              'revision': revision, 
3382              'branch': branch, 
3383              'chost': chost,

3385              'cxxflags': cxxflags,

3388              'eclasses': self.retrieveEclasses(idpackage), 
3389              'content': pkg_content, 
3390              'spm_phases': self.retrieveSpmPhases(idpackage), 
3391          } 
3392          return data

3394 -    def getPackageData(self, idpackage, get_content = True,

3396          """ 
3397          Reconstruct all the package metadata belonging to provided package 
3398          identifier into a dict object. 
3399   
3400          @param idpackage: package indentifier 
3401          @type idpackage: int 
3402          @keyword get_content: 
3403          @type get_content: bool 
3404          @keyword content_insert_formatted: 
3405          @type content_insert_formatted: bool 
3406          @keyword trigger_unicode: 
3407          @type trigger_unicode: bool

3409   
3410          >>> data = { 
3411              'atom': atom,

3413              'version': version, 
3414              'versiontag':versiontag, 
3415              'description': description,

3419              'cxxflags': cxxflags, 
3420              'homepage': homepage, 
3421              'license': mylicense, 
3422              'branch': branch, 
3423              'download': download, 
3424              'digest': digest, 
3425              'slot': slot, 
3426              'etpapi': etpapi, 
3427              'datecreation': datecreation, 
3428              'size': size, 
3429              'revision': revision, 
3430              'counter': self.retrieveSpmUid(idpackage), 
3431              'messages': self.retrieveMessages(idpackage), 
3432              'trigger': self.retrieveTrigger(idpackage, 
3433                  get_unicode = trigger_unicode), 
3434              'disksize': self.retrieveOnDiskSize(idpackage), 
3435              'changelog': self.retrieveChangelog(idpackage), 
3436              'injected': self.isInjected(idpackage), 
3437              'systempackage': self.isSystemPackage(idpackage), 
3438              'config_protect': self.retrieveProtect(idpackage), 
3439              'config_protect_mask': self.retrieveProtectMask(idpackage), 
3440              'useflags': self.retrieveUseflags(idpackage), 
3441              'keywords': self.retrieveKeywords(idpackage), 
3442              'sources': sources, 
3443              'eclasses': self.retrieveEclasses(idpackage), 
3444              'needed': self.retrieveNeeded(idpackage, extended = True), 
3445              'needed_paths': self.retrieveNeededPaths(idpackage), 
3446              'provide': self.retrieveProvide(idpackage), 
3447              'conflicts': self.retrieveConflicts(idpackage), 
3448              'licensedata': self.retrieveLicensedata(idpackage), 
3449              'content': content, 
3450              'dependencies': dict((x, y,) for x, y in \ 
3451                  self.retrieveDependencies(idpackage, extended = True)), 
3452              'mirrorlinks': [[x,self.retrieveMirrorInfo(x)] for x in mirrornames], 
3453              'signatures': signatures, 
3454              'spm_phases': self.retrieveSpmPhases(idpackage), 
3455          } 
3456   
3457          @rtype: dict 
3458          """ 
3459   
3460          data = {} 
3461          try: 
3462              atom, name, version, versiontag, \ 
3463              description, category, chost, \ 
3464              cflags, cxxflags,homepage, \ 
3465              mylicense, branch, download, \ 
3466              digest, slot, etpapi, \ 
3467              datecreation, size, revision  = self.getBaseData(idpackage) 
3468          except TypeError: 
3469              return None 
3470   
3471          content = {} 
3472          if get_content: 
3473              content = self.retrieveContent( 
3474                  idpackage, extended = True, 
3475                  formatted = True, insert_formatted = content_insert_formatted 
3476              ) 
3477   
3478          sources = self.retrieveSources(idpackage) 
3479          mirrornames = set() 
3480          for x in sources: 
3481              if x.startswith("mirror://"): 
3482                  mirrornames.add(x.split("/")[2]) 
3483   
3484          sha1, sha256, sha512 = self.retrieveSignatures(idpackage) 
3485          signatures = { 
3486              'sha1': sha1, 
3487              'sha256': sha256, 
3488              'sha512': sha512, 
3489          } 
3490   
3491          data = { 
3492              'atom': atom, 
3493              'name': name, 
3494              'version': version, 
3495              'versiontag':versiontag, 
3496              'description': description, 
3497              'category': category, 
3498              'chost': chost, 
3499              'cflags': cflags, 
3500              'cxxflags': cxxflags, 
3501              'homepage': homepage, 
3502              'license': mylicense, 
3503              'branch': branch, 
3504              'download': download, 
3505              'digest': digest, 
3506              'slot': slot, 
3507              'etpapi': etpapi, 
3508              'datecreation': datecreation, 
3509              'size': size, 
3510              'revision': revision, 
3511              # risky to add to the sql above, still 
3512              'counter': self.retrieveSpmUid(idpackage), 
3513              'messages': self.retrieveMessages(idpackage), 
3514              'trigger': self.retrieveTrigger(idpackage, get_unicode = trigger_unicode), 
3515              'disksize': self.retrieveOnDiskSize(idpackage), 
3516              'changelog': self.retrieveChangelog(idpackage), 
3517              'injected': self.isInjected(idpackage), 
3518              'systempackage': self.isSystemPackage(idpackage), 
3519              'config_protect': self.retrieveProtect(idpackage), 
3520              'config_protect_mask': self.retrieveProtectMask(idpackage), 
3521              'useflags': self.retrieveUseflags(idpackage), 
3522              'keywords': self.retrieveKeywords(idpackage), 
3523              'sources': sources, 
3524              'eclasses': self.retrieveEclasses(idpackage), 
3525              'needed': self.retrieveNeeded(idpackage, extended = True), 
3526              'needed_paths': self.retrieveNeededPaths(idpackage), 
3527              'provide': self.retrieveProvide(idpackage), 
3528              'conflicts': self.retrieveConflicts(idpackage), 
3529              'licensedata': self.retrieveLicensedata(idpackage), 
3530              'content': content, 
3531              'dependencies': dict((x, y,) for x, y in \ 
3532                  self.retrieveDependencies(idpackage, extended = True)), 
3533              'mirrorlinks': [[x,self.retrieveMirrorInfo(x)] for x in mirrornames], 
3534              'signatures': signatures, 
3535              'spm_phases': self.retrieveSpmPhases(idpackage), 
3536          } 
3537   
3538          return data

3540 -    def _cur2set(self, cur): 

3541          mycontent = set() 
3542          for x in cur: 
3543              mycontent |= set(x) 
3544          return mycontent 

3545   

3546 -    def _fetchall2set(self, item): 

3547          mycontent = set() 
3548          for x in item: 
3549              mycontent |= set(x) 
3550          return mycontent 

3551   

3552 -    def _fetchall2list(self, item): 

3553          content = [] 
3554          for x in item: 
3555              content += list(x) 
3556          return content

3569              docstring_title

3572              @type name: 
3573              @return: 
3574              @rtype:

3663 -    def bumpTreeUpdatesActions(self, updates): 

3664          # mainly used to restore a previous table, 
3665          # used by reagent in --initialize 
3666          """ 
3667          This method should be considered internal and not suited for general 
3668          audience. 
3669          This method rewrites "treeupdates" metadata in repository. 
3670   
3671          @param updates: new treeupdates metadata 
3672          @type updates: list 
3673          """ 
3674          with self.__write_mutex: 
3675              self.cursor.execute('DELETE FROM treeupdatesactions') 
3676              self.cursor.executemany(""" 
3677              INSERT INTO treeupdatesactions VALUES (?,?,?,?,?) 
3678              """, updates) 
3679              self.commitChanges()

3699          audience.

3701   
3702          @param updates: new treeupdates metadata 
3703          @type updates: list 
3704          @param repository: insert treeupdates metadata for provided repository 
3705          @type repository: string 
3706          """

3727              DELETE FROM treeupdates where repository = (?)

3730              INSERT INTO treeupdates VALUES (?,?)

3762          provided branch exists. 
3763

3765          @type repository: string

3767          @type command: string

3769          @type branch: string 
3770          @return: if True, provided treeupdates action already exists 
3771          @rtype: bool 
3772          """ 
3773          self.cursor.execute(""" 
3774          SELECT * FROM treeupdatesactions  
3775          WHERE repository = (?) and command = (?) 
3776          and branch = (?)""", (repository, command, branch,)) 
3777   
3778          result = self.cursor.fetchone() 
3779          if result: 
3780              return True 
3781          return False

3803                      continue

3954 -    def retrieveSpmUid(self, idpackage): 

3955          """

3957          package identifier. 
3958

3960          @type idpackage: int

3963          """

3968          baseinfo.branch = counters.branch""", (idpackage,)) 
3969          mycounter = cur.fetchone() 
3970          if mycounter:

3972          return -1

4494 -    def retrieveDependencies(self, idpackage, extended = False, deptype = None, 
4495          exclude_deptypes = None): 

4496          """ 
4497          Return dependencies for given package identifier. 
4498   
4499          @param idpackage: package indentifier 
4500          @type idpackage: int 
4501          @keyword extended: return in extended format (list of tuples of length 2 
4502              composed by dependency name and dependency type) 
4503          @type extended: bool

4506              identifiers

4519

4523                  if not isinstance(dep_type, (int, long,)): 
4524                      # filter out crap 
4525                      continue 
4526                  excluded_deptypes_query += " AND dependencies.type != %s" % ( 
4527                      dep_type,) 
4528

4531              SELECT dependenciesreference.dependency,dependencies.type 
4532              FROM dependencies,dependenciesreference 
4533              WHERE dependencies.idpackage = (?) AND 
4534              dependencies.iddependency = 
4535              dependenciesreference.iddependency %s %s""" % ( 
4536                  depstring,excluded_deptypes_query,), searchdata) 
4537              return cur.fetchall()

4543              dependencies.iddependency =

4621 -    def retrieveSources(self, idpackage, extended = False): 

4622          """ 
4623          Return source package URLs for given package identifier. 
4624          "source" as in source code. 
4625   
4626          @param idpackage: package indentifier 
4627          @type idpackage: int 
4628          @keyword extended:  
4629          @type extended: bool 
4630          @return: if extended is True, dict composed by source URLs as key 
4631              and list of mirrors as value, otherwise just a list (set) of 
4632              source package URLs. 
4633          @rtype: dict or set 
4634          """ 
4635          cur = self.cursor.execute(""" 
4636          SELECT sourcesreference.source FROM sources, sourcesreference 
4637          WHERE idpackage = (?) AND 
4638          sources.idsource = sourcesreference.idsource 
4639          """, (idpackage,)) 
4640          sources = self._fetchall2set(cur.fetchall()) 
4641          if not extended: 
4642              return sources 
4643   
4644          source_data = {} 
4645          mirror_str = "mirror://" 
4646          for source in sources: 
4647   
4648              source_data[source] = set() 
4649              if source.startswith(mirror_str): 
4650   
4651                  mirrorname = source.split("/")[2] 
4652                  mirror_url =  source.split("/", 3)[3:][0] 
4653                  source_data[source] |= set( 
4654                      [os.path.join(url, mirror_url) for url in \ 
4655                          self.retrieveMirrorInfo(mirrorname)]) 
4656   
4657              else: 
4658                  source_data[source].add(source) 
4659   
4660          return source_data 

4661   

4662 -    def retrieveAutomergefiles(self, idpackage, get_dict = False): 

4663          """ 
4664          Return previously merged protected configuration files list and 
4665          their md5 hashes for given package identifier. 
4666          This is part of the "automerge" feature which uses file md5 checksum 
4667          to determine if a protected configuration file can be merged auto- 
4668          matically. 
4669   
4670          @param idpackage: package indentifier 
4671          @type idpackage: int 
4672          @keyword get_dict: return a dictionary with configuration file as key 
4673              and md5 hash as value 
4674          @type get_dict: bool 
4675          @return: automerge metadata for given package identifier 
4676          @rtype: list or set 
4677          """ 
4678          # FIXME backward compatibility 
4679          if not self.doesTableExist('automergefiles'): 
4680              self._createAutomergefilesTable() 
4681   
4682          # like portage does 
4683          self.connection.text_factory = lambda x: \ 
4684              unicode(x, "raw_unicode_escape") 
4685   
4686          cur = self.cursor.execute(""" 
4687          SELECT configfile, md5 FROM automergefiles WHERE idpackage = (?) 
4688          """, (idpackage,)) 
4689          data = cur.fetchall() 
4690   
4691          if get_dict: 
4692              data = dict(((x, y,) for x, y in data)) 
4693          return data 

4694   

4695 -    def retrieveContent(self, idpackage, extended = False, contentType = None, 
4696          formatted = False, insert_formatted = False, order_by = ''): 

4697          """ 
4698          Return files contained in given package. 
4699   
4700          @param idpackage: package indentifier 
4701          @type idpackage: int 
4702          @keyword extended: return in extended format 
4703          @type extended: bool 
4704          @keyword contentType: only return given entry type, which can be: 
4705              "obj", "sym" or "dir" 
4706          @type contentType: int 
4707          @keyword formatted: return in dict() form 
4708          @type formatted: bool 
4709          @keyword insert_formatted: return in list of tuples form, ready to 
4710              be added with insertContent() 
4711          @keyword order_by: order by string, valid values are: 
4712              "type" (if extended is True), "file" or "idpackage" 
4713          @type order_by: string 
4714          @return: content metadata 
4715          @rtype: dict or list or set 
4716          """ 
4717          extstring = '' 
4718          if extended: 
4719              extstring = ",type" 
4720          extstring_idpackage = '' 
4721          if insert_formatted: 
4722              extstring_idpackage = 'idpackage,' 
4723   
4724          searchkeywords = [idpackage] 
4725          contentstring = '' 
4726          if contentType: 
4727              searchkeywords.append(contentType) 
4728              contentstring = ' and type = (?)' 
4729   
4730          order_by_string = '' 
4731          if order_by: 
4732              order_by_string = ' order by %s' % (order_by,) 
4733   
4734          did_try = False 
4735          while 1: 
4736              try: 
4737   
4738                  cur = self.cursor.execute(""" 
4739                  SELECT %s file%s FROM content WHERE idpackage = (?) %s%s""" % ( 
4740                      extstring_idpackage, extstring, 
4741                      contentstring, order_by_string,), 
4742                  searchkeywords) 
4743   
4744                  if extended and insert_formatted: 
4745                      fl = cur.fetchall() 
4746   
4747                  elif extended and formatted: 
4748                      fl = {} 
4749                      items = cur.fetchone() 
4750                      while items: 
4751                          fl[items[0]] = items[1] 
4752                          items = cur.fetchone() 
4753   
4754                  elif extended: 
4755                      fl = cur.fetchall() 
4756   
4757                  else: 
4758                      if order_by: 
4759                          fl = self._fetchall2list(cur.fetchall()) 
4760                      else: 
4761                          fl = self._fetchall2set(cur.fetchall()) 
4762   
4763                  break 
4764   
4765              except self.dbapi2.OperationalError: 
4766   
4767                  if did_try: 
4768                      raise 
4769                  did_try = True 
4770   
4771                  # FIXME support for old entropy db entries, which were 
4772                  # not inserted in utf-8 
4773                  self.connection.text_factory = lambda x: \ 
4774                      unicode(x, "raw_unicode_escape") 
4775                  continue 
4776   
4777          return fl

4790              return None

4793          SELECT packagechangelogs.changelog 
4794          FROM packagechangelogs, baseinfo, categories 
4795          WHERE baseinfo.idpackage = (?) AND 
4796          baseinfo.idcategory = categories.idcategory AND 
4797          packagechangelogs.name = baseinfo.name AND 
4798          packagechangelogs.category = categories.category""", (idpackage,))

4803                  return unicode(changelog, 'raw_unicode_escape') 
4804              except UnicodeDecodeError:

4917 -    def retrieveLicensedata(self, idpackage): 

4918          """ 
4919          Return license metadata for given package identifier. 
4920   
4921          @param idpackage: package indentifier 
4922          @type idpackage: int 
4923          @return: dictionary composed by license name as key and license text 
4924              as value 
4925          @rtype: dict 
4926          """ 
4927   
4928          licenses = self.retrieveLicense(idpackage) 
4929          if licenses is None: 
4930              return {} 
4931   
4932          licdata = {} 
4933          for licname in licenses.split(): 
4934   
4935              if not licname.strip(): 
4936                  continue 
4937   
4938              if not self.entropyTools.is_valid_string(licname): 
4939                  continue 
4940   
4941              cur = self.cursor.execute(""" 
4942              SELECT text FROM licensedata WHERE licensename = (?) 
4943              """, (licname,)) 
4944              lictext = cur.fetchone() 
4945              if lictext is not None: 
4946                  lictext = lictext[0] 
4947                  try: 
4948                      licdata[licname] = unicode(lictext, 'raw_unicode_escape') 
4949                  except UnicodeDecodeError: 
4950                      licdata[licname] = unicode(lictext, 'utf-8') 
4951   
4952          return licdata 

4953   

4954 -    def retrieveLicensedataKeys(self, idpackage): 

4955          """ 
4956          Return license names available for given package identifier. 
4957

4959          @type idpackage: int

4961              repository 
4962          @rtype: set 
4963          """ 
4964

4966          if licenses is None: 
4967              return set() 
4968   
4969          licdata = set() 
4970          for licname in licenses.split(): 
4971   
4972              if not licname.strip(): 
4973                  continue 
4974   
4975              if not self.entropyTools.is_valid_string(licname): 
4976                  continue 
4977   
4978              cur = self.cursor.execute(""" 
4979              SELECT licensename FROM licensedata WHERE licensename = (?) 
4980              """, (licname,)) 
4981              lic_id = cur.fetchone() 
4982              if lic_id: 
4983                  licdata.add(lic_id[0]) 
4984   
4985          return licdata

5045 -    def retrieveReverseDependencies(self, idpackage, atoms = False, 
5046          key_slot = False, exclude_deptypes = None): 

5047          """ 
5048          Return reverse (or inverse) dependencies for given package. 
5049   
5050          @param idpackage: package indentifier 
5051          @type idpackage: int 
5052          @keyword atoms: if True, method returns list of atoms 
5053          @type atoms: bool 
5054          @keyword key_slot: if True, method returns list of dependencies in 
5055              key:slot form, example: [('app-foo/bar','2',), ...] 
5056          @type key_slot: bool 
5057          @keyword exclude_deptypes: exclude given dependency types from returned 
5058              data 
5059          @type exclude_deptypes: iterable 
5060          @return: reverse dependency list 
5061          @rtype: list or set 
5062   
5063          """ 
5064   
5065          # WARNING: never remove this, otherwise equo.db 
5066          # (client database) dependstable will be always broken (trust me) 
5067          # sanity check on the table 
5068          if not self.isDependsTableSane(): # is empty, need generation 
5069              self.regenerateDependsTable(output = False) 
5070   
5071          excluded_deptypes_query = "" 
5072          if exclude_deptypes != None: 
5073              for dep_type in exclude_deptypes: 
5074                  excluded_deptypes_query += " AND dependencies.type != %s" % ( 
5075                      dep_type,) 
5076   
5077          if atoms: 
5078              cur = self.cursor.execute(""" 
5079              SELECT baseinfo.atom FROM dependstable,dependencies,baseinfo  
5080              WHERE dependstable.idpackage = (?) AND  
5081              dependstable.iddependency = dependencies.iddependency AND  
5082              baseinfo.idpackage = dependencies.idpackage %s""" % ( 
5083                  excluded_deptypes_query,), (idpackage,)) 
5084              result = self._fetchall2set(cur.fetchall()) 
5085          elif key_slot: 
5086              cur = self.cursor.execute(""" 
5087              SELECT categories.category || "/" || baseinfo.name,baseinfo.slot  
5088              FROM baseinfo,categories,dependstable,dependencies  
5089              WHERE dependstable.idpackage = (?) AND  
5090              dependstable.iddependency = dependencies.iddependency AND  
5091              baseinfo.idpackage = dependencies.idpackage AND  
5092              categories.idcategory = baseinfo.idcategory %s""" % ( 
5093                  excluded_deptypes_query,), (idpackage,)) 
5094              result = cur.fetchall() 
5095          else: 
5096              cur = self.cursor.execute(""" 
5097              SELECT dependencies.idpackage FROM dependstable,dependencies  
5098              WHERE dependstable.idpackage = (?) AND  
5099              dependstable.iddependency = dependencies.iddependency %s""" % ( 
5100                  excluded_deptypes_query,), (idpackage,)) 
5101              result = self._fetchall2set(cur.fetchall()) 
5102   
5103          return result

5105 -    def retrieveUnusedIdpackages(self): 

5106          """ 
5107          Return packages (through their identifiers) not referenced by any 
5108          other as dependency (unused packages). 
5109   
5110          @return: unused idpackages ordered by atom 
5111          @rtype: list 
5112          """ 
5113   
5114          # WARNING: never remove this, otherwise equo.db (client database) 
5115          # dependstable will be always broken (trust me) 
5116          # sanity check on the table 
5117          if not self.isDependsTableSane(): # is empty, need generation 
5118              self.regenerateDependsTable(output = False) 
5119   
5120          cur = self.cursor.execute(""" 
5121          SELECT idpackage FROM baseinfo  
5122          WHERE idpackage NOT IN (SELECT idpackage FROM dependstable) 
5123          ORDER BY atom 
5124          """) 
5125          return self._fetchall2list(cur.fetchall())

5143 -    def areIdpackagesAvailable(self, idpackages): 

5144          """ 
5145          Return whether list of package identifiers are available. 
5146          They must be all available to return True 
5147   
5148          @param idpackages: list of package indentifiers 
5149          @type idpackages: iterable 
5150          @return: availability (True if all are available) 
5151          @rtype: bool 
5152          """ 
5153          sql = """SELECT count(idpackage) FROM baseinfo 
5154          WHERE idpackage IN (%s)""" % (','.join( 
5155              [str(x) for x in set(idpackages)]), 
5156          ) 
5157          cur = self.cursor.execute(sql) 
5158          count = cur.fetchone()[0] 
5159          if count != len(idpackages): 
5160              return False 
5161          return True

5236 -    def resolveNeeded(self, needed, elfclass = -1, extended = False): 

5237          """ 
5238          Resolve NEEDED ELF entry (a library name) to idpackages owning given 
5239          needed (stressing, needed = library name) 
5240   
5241          @param needed: library name 
5242          @type needed: string 
5243          @keyword elfclass: look for library name matching given ELF class 
5244          @type elfclass: int 
5245          @keyword extended: return a list of tuple of length 2, first element 
5246              is idpackage, second is actual library path 
5247          @type extended: bool 
5248          @return: list of packages owning given library 
5249          @rtype: list or set 
5250          """ 
5251   
5252          args = [needed] 
5253          elfclass_txt = '' 
5254   
5255          if extended: 
5256              if elfclass != -1: 
5257                  elfclass_txt = ' AND neededlibraryidpackages.elfclass = (?)' 
5258                  args.append(elfclass) 
5259              cur = self.cursor.execute(""" 
5260                  SELECT neededlibraryidpackages.idpackage, 
5261                  neededlibrarypaths.path 
5262                  FROM neededlibraryidpackages, neededlibrarypaths 
5263                  WHERE neededlibraryidpackages.library = (?) AND 
5264                  neededlibraryidpackages.library = neededlibrarypaths.library AND 
5265                  neededlibraryidpackages.elfclass = neededlibrarypaths.elfclass 
5266              """ + elfclass_txt, args) 
5267              return cur.fetchall() 
5268   
5269          # else 
5270          if elfclass != -1: 
5271              elfclass_txt = ' AND elfclass = (?)' 
5272              args.append(elfclass) 
5273          cur = self.cursor.execute(""" 
5274              SELECT idpackage FROM neededlibraryidpackages 
5275              WHERE library = (?) 
5276          """ + elfclass_txt, args) 
5277          return self._fetchall2set(cur.fetchall()) 

5278

5462          """ 
5463          Mark license name as accepted by user. 
5464          Only and only if user is allowed to accept them: 
5465              - in entropy group 
5466              - db not open in read only mode 
5467   
5468          @param license_name: license name 
5469          @type license_name: string 
5470          @todo: check if readOnly is really required 
5471          @todo: check if is_user_in_entropy_group is really required 
5472          """ 
5473          if self.readOnly: 
5474              return 
5475          if not self.entropyTools.is_user_in_entropy_group(): 
5476              return 
5477   
5478          with self.__write_mutex: 
5479              self.cursor.execute(""" 
5480              INSERT OR IGNORE INTO licenses_accepted VALUES (?) 
5481              """, (license_name,)) 
5482              self.commitChanges() 

5483

5813 -    def searchSimilarPackages(self, mystring, atom = False): 

5814          """

5816          argument) using SOUNDEX algorithm (ahhh Google...). 
5817

5819          @type mystring: string

5826          if atom: 
5827              s_item = 'atom'

5829          SELECT idpackage FROM baseinfo  
5830          WHERE soundex(%s) = soundex((?)) ORDER BY %s 
5831          """ % (s_item, s_item,), (mystring,)) 
5832   
5833          return self._fetchall2list(cur.fetchall())

5835 -    def searchPackages(self, keyword, sensitive = False, slot = None, 
5836              tag = None, order_by = 'atom', just_id = False): 

5837          """ 
5838          Search packages using given package name "keyword" argument. 
5839   
5840          @param keyword: package string 
5841          @type keyword: string 
5842          @keyword sensitive: case sensitive? 
5843          @type sensitive: bool 
5844          @keyword slot: search matching given slot 
5845          @type slot: string 
5846          @keyword tag: search matching given package tag 
5847          @type tag: string

5849          @type order_by: string 
5850          @keyword just_id: just return package identifiers (returning set()) 
5851          @type just_id: bool 
5852          @return: packages found matching given search criterias 
5853          @rtype: set or list 
5854          """

5856

5859              searchkeywords.append(slot) 
5860              slotstring = ' and slot = (?)' 
5861

5863          if tag: 
5864              searchkeywords.append(tag) 
5865              tagstring = ' and versiontag = (?)' 
5866

5869              order_by_string = ' order by %s' % (order_by,) 
5870

5872          if just_id: 
5873              search_elements = 'idpackage' 
5874   
5875          if sensitive: 
5876              cur = self.cursor.execute(""" 
5877              SELECT %s FROM baseinfo WHERE atom LIKE (?) %s %s %s""" %  ( 
5878                  search_elements, slotstring, tagstring, order_by_string,), 
5879                  searchkeywords 
5880              ) 
5881          else: 
5882              cur = self.cursor.execute(""" 
5883              SELECT %s FROM baseinfo WHERE  
5884              LOWER(atom) LIKE (?) %s %s %s""" % ( 
5885                  search_elements, slotstring, tagstring, order_by_string,),

6103 -    def isPackageScopeAvailable(self, atom, slot, revision): 

6104          """ 
6105          Return whether given package scope is available. 
6106          Also check if package found is masked and return masking reason 
6107          identifier. 
6108   
6109          @param atom: package atom string 
6110          @type atom: string 
6111          @param slot: package slot string 
6112          @type slot: string 
6113          @param revision: entropy package revision 
6114          @type revision: int 
6115          @return: tuple composed by (idpackage or -1, idreason or 0,) 
6116          @rtype: tuple 
6117   
6118          """

6121          SELECT idpackage FROM baseinfo 
6122          where atom = (?) 
6123          AND slot = (?) 
6124          AND revision = (?)""", searchdata) 
6125          rslt = cur.fetchone() 
6126   
6127          if rslt: # check if it's masked 
6128              return self.idpackageValidator(rslt[0]) 
6129          return -1, 0

6131 -    def isBranchMigrationAvailable(self, repository, from_branch, to_branch): 

6132          """ 
6133          Returns whether branch migration metadata given by the provided key 
6134          (repository, from_branch, to_branch,) is available. 
6135   
6136          @param repository: repository identifier 
6137          @type repository: string 
6138          @param from_branch: original branch 
6139          @type from_branch: string 
6140          @param to_branch: destination branch 
6141          @type to_branch: string 
6142          @return: tuple composed by (1)post migration script md5sum and 
6143              (2)post upgrade script md5sum 
6144          @rtype: tuple 
6145          """ 
6146          cur = self.cursor.execute(""" 
6147          SELECT post_migration_md5sum, post_upgrade_md5sum 
6148          FROM entropy_branch_migration 
6149          WHERE repository = (?) AND from_branch = (?) AND to_branch = (?) 
6150          """, (repository, from_branch, to_branch,)) 
6151          return cur.fetchone()

6196              if just_files: 
6197                  results.add(download) 
6198              else: 
6199                  results.add((download, injected)) 
6200   
6201          return results

6453 -    def getIdpackagesDifferences(self, foreign_idpackages): 

6454          """ 
6455          docstring_title 
6456   
6457          @param foreign_idpackages: 
6458          @type foreign_idpackages: 
6459          @return: 
6460          @rtype: 
6461   
6462          """ 
6463          myids = self.listAllIdpackages() 
6464          if isinstance(foreign_idpackages, (list, tuple,)): 
6465              outids = set(foreign_idpackages) 
6466          else: 
6467              outids = foreign_idpackages 
6468          added_ids = outids - myids 
6469          removed_ids = myids - outids 
6470          return added_ids, removed_ids

6489          docstring_title 
6490   
6491          @param dbconn: 
6492          @type dbconn: 
6493          @keyword force: 
6494          @type force: 
6495          @keyword output_header: 
6496          @type output_header: 
6497          @keyword align_limit: 
6498          @type align_limit: 
6499          @return: 
6500          @rtype: 
6501   
6502          """ 
6503   
6504          added_ids, removed_ids = self.getIdpackagesDifferences(dbconn.listAllIdpackages()) 
6505   
6506          if not force: 
6507              if len(added_ids) > align_limit: # too much hassle 
6508                  return 0 
6509              if len(removed_ids) > align_limit: # too much hassle 
6510                  return 0 
6511   
6512          if not added_ids and not removed_ids: 
6513              return -1 
6514   
6515          mytxt = red("%s, %s ...") % (_("Syncing current database"), _("please wait"),) 
6516          self.updateProgress( 
6517              mytxt, 
6518              importance = 1, 
6519              type = "info", 
6520              header = output_header, 
6521              back = True 
6522          ) 
6523          maxcount = len(removed_ids) 
6524          mycount = 0 
6525          for idpackage in removed_ids: 
6526              mycount += 1 
6527              mytxt = "%s: %s" % (red(_("Removing entry")), blue(str(self.retrieveAtom(idpackage))),) 
6528              self.updateProgress( 
6529                  mytxt, 
6530                  importance = 0, 
6531                  type = "info", 
6532                  header = output_header, 
6533                  back = True, 
6534                  count = (mycount, maxcount) 
6535              ) 
6536              self.removePackage(idpackage, do_cleanup = False, do_commit = False) 
6537   
6538          maxcount = len(added_ids) 
6539          mycount = 0 
6540          for idpackage in added_ids: 
6541              mycount += 1 
6542              mytxt = "%s: %s" % (red(_("Adding entry")), blue(str(dbconn.retrieveAtom(idpackage))),) 
6543              self.updateProgress( 
6544                  mytxt, 
6545                  importance = 0, 
6546                  type = "info", 
6547                  header = output_header, 
6548                  back = True, 
6549                  count = (mycount, maxcount) 
6550              ) 
6551              mydata = dbconn.getPackageData(idpackage, get_content = True, content_insert_formatted = True) 
6552              self.addPackage( 
6553                  mydata, 
6554                  revision = mydata['revision'], 
6555                  idpackage = idpackage, 
6556                  do_commit = False, 
6557                  formatted_content = True 
6558              ) 
6559   
6560          # do some cleanups 
6561          self.doCleanups()

6563          self.clearCache() 
6564          self.commitChanges() 
6565          self.regenerateDependsTable(output = False) 
6566          dbconn.clearCache() 
6567   
6568          # verify both checksums, if they don't match, bomb out 
6569          mycheck = self.database_checksum(do_order = True, strict = False) 
6570          outcheck = dbconn.database_checksum(do_order = True, strict = False) 
6571          if mycheck == outcheck: 
6572              return 1 
6573          return 0

6621          self.cursor.execute("SELECT name, type, sql FROM sqlite_master WHERE sql NOT NULL AND type=='table'") 
6622          for name, x, sql in self.cursor.fetchall(): 
6623   
6624              self.updateProgress( 
6625                  red("%s " % (_("Exporting database table"),) )+"["+blue(str(name))+"]", 
6626                  importance = 0, 
6627                  type = "info", 
6628                  back = True, 
6629                  header = "   " 
6630              ) 
6631

6633                  dumpfile.write("DELETE FROM sqlite_sequence;\n") 
6634              elif name == "sqlite_stat1": 
6635                  dumpfile.write("ANALYZE sqlite_master;\n")

6637                  continue 
6638              else: 
6639                  t_cmd = "CREATE TABLE" 
6640                  if sql.startswith(t_cmd) and gentle_with_tables:

6642                  dumpfile.write("%s;\n" % sql)

6645                  continue

6650              q += ", ".join(["'||quote(" + x + ")||'" for x in cols]) 
6651              q += ")' FROM '%(tbl_name)s'" 
6652              self.cursor.execute(q % {'tbl_name': name}) 
6653              self.connection.text_factory = lambda x: unicode(x, "raw_unicode_escape") 
6654              for row in self.cursor: 
6655                  dumpfile.write("%s;\n" % str(row[0].encode('raw_unicode_escape')))

6659              dumpfile.write("%s;\n" % sql) 
6660   
6661          dumpfile.write("COMMIT;\n") 
6662          try: 
6663              dumpfile.flush() 
6664          except: 
6665              pass 
6666          self.updateProgress( 
6667              red(_("Database Export completed.")), 
6668              importance = 0, 
6669              type = "info", 
6670              header = "   " 
6671          )

6717 -    def database_checksum(self, do_order = False, strict = True, strings = False): 

6718          """ 
6719          docstring_title

6721          @keyword do_order: 
6722          @type do_order: 
6723          @keyword strict: 
6724          @type strict: 
6725          @keyword strings: 
6726          @type strings: 
6727          @return: 
6728          @rtype: 
6729   
6730          """ 
6731   
6732          c_tup = ("database_checksum", do_order, strict, strings,) 
6733          cache = self.live_cache.get(c_tup) 
6734          if cache != None: return cache 
6735   
6736          idpackage_order = '' 
6737          category_order = '' 
6738          license_order = '' 
6739          flags_order = '' 
6740          if do_order: 
6741              idpackage_order = 'order by idpackage' 
6742              category_order = 'order by category' 
6743              license_order = 'order by license' 
6744              flags_order = 'order by chost' 
6745   
6746          def do_update_md5(m, cursor): 
6747              """ 
6748              docstring_title 
6749   
6750              @param m: 
6751              @type m: 
6752              @param cursor: 
6753              @type cursor: 
6754              @return: 
6755              @rtype: 
6756   
6757              """ 
6758              mydata = cursor.fetchall() 
6759              for record in mydata: 
6760                  for item in record: 
6761                      m.update(str(item)) 

6762   
6763          if strings: 
6764              import hashlib 
6765              m = hashlib.md5() 
6766   
6767          self.cursor.execute(""" 
6768          SELECT idpackage,atom,name,version,versiontag, 
6769          revision,branch,slot,etpapi,trigger FROM  
6770          baseinfo %s""" % (idpackage_order,)) 
6771          if strings: 
6772              do_update_md5(m, self.cursor) 
6773          else: 
6774              a_hash = hash(tuple(self.cursor.fetchall())) 
6775          self.cursor.execute(""" 
6776          SELECT idpackage,description,homepage, 
6777          download,size,digest,datecreation FROM  
6778          extrainfo %s""" % (idpackage_order,)) 
6779          if strings: 
6780              do_update_md5(m, self.cursor) 
6781          else: 
6782              b_hash = hash(tuple(self.cursor.fetchall())) 
6783          self.cursor.execute('select category from categories %s' % (category_order,)) 
6784          if strings: 
6785              do_update_md5(m, self.cursor) 
6786          else: 
6787              c_hash = hash(tuple(self.cursor.fetchall())) 
6788          d_hash = '0' 
6789          e_hash = '0' 
6790          if strict: 
6791              self.cursor.execute('select * from licenses %s' % (license_order,)) 
6792              if strings: 
6793                  do_update_md5(m, self.cursor) 
6794              else: 
6795                  d_hash = hash(tuple(self.cursor.fetchall())) 
6796              self.cursor.execute('select * from flags %s' % (flags_order,)) 
6797              if strings: 
6798                  do_update_md5(m, self.cursor) 
6799              else: 
6800                  e_hash = hash(tuple(self.cursor.fetchall())) 
6801   
6802          if strings: 
6803              result = m.hexdigest() 
6804          else: 
6805              result = "%s:%s:%s:%s:%s" % (a_hash, b_hash, c_hash, d_hash, e_hash,) 
6806   
6807          self.live_cache[c_tup] = result[:] 
6808          return result

6816 -    def updateInstalledTableSource(self, idpackage, source):

6821          @type idpackage: int 
6822          @param source: 
6823          @type source: 
6824          @return: 
6825          @rtype: 
6826   
6827          """ 
6828          with self.__write_mutex:

6830              UPDATE installedtable SET source = (?) WHERE idpackage = (?)

6934          docstring_title

6936          @return: 
6937          @rtype: 
6938   
6939          """

6941              self.cursor.execute('SELECT iddependency FROM dependstable WHERE iddependency = -1') 
6942          except (self.dbapi2.OperationalError,): 
6943              return False # table does not exist, please regenerate and re-run 
6944          status = self.cursor.fetchone() 
6945          if status: return False

6948          dependstable_count = self.cursor.fetchone()

6950              return False 
6951          return True

7000 -    def retrieveBranchMigration(self, to_branch): 

7001          """ 
7002          This method returns branch migration metadata stored in Entropy 
7003          Client database (installed packages database). It is used to 
7004          determine whether to run per-repository branch migration scripts. 
7005   
7006          @param to_branch: usually the current branch string 
7007          @type to_branch: string 
7008          @return: branch migration metadata contained in database 
7009          @rtype: dict 
7010          """ 
7011          if not self.doesTableExist('entropy_branch_migration'): 
7012              return None 
7013   
7014          self.cursor.execute(""" 
7015          SELECT repository, from_branch, post_migration_md5sum, 
7016          post_upgrade_md5sum FROM entropy_branch_migration WHERE to_branch = (?) 
7017          """, (to_branch,)) 
7018   
7019          data = self.cursor.fetchall() 
7020          meta = {} 
7021          for repo, from_branch, post_migration_md5, post_upgrade_md5 in data: 
7022              obj = meta.setdefault(repo, {}) 
7023              obj[from_branch] = (post_migration_md5, post_upgrade_md5,) 
7024          return meta

7037 -    def dropAllIndexes(self):

7039          docstring_title

7042          @rtype: 
7043   
7044          """

7048              for index in indexes:

7052 -    def listAllIndexes(self, only_entropy = True): 

7053          """ 
7054          docstring_title 
7055   
7056          @keyword only_entropy: 
7057          @type only_entropy: 
7058          @return: 
7059          @rtype: 
7060   
7061          """ 
7062          self.cursor.execute('SELECT name FROM SQLITE_MASTER WHERE type = "index"')

7064          if not only_entropy: 
7065              return indexes 
7066          myindexes = set() 
7067          for index in indexes: 
7068              if index.startswith("sqlite"): 
7069                  continue 
7070              myindexes.add(index) 
7071          return myindexes

7478 -    def regenerateCountersTable(self, vdb_path, output = False): 

7479          """ 
7480          docstring_title 
7481   
7482          @param vdb_path: 
7483          @type vdb_path: 
7484          @keyword output: 
7485          @type output: 
7486          @return: 
7487          @rtype: 
7488   
7489          """ 
7490   
7491          # this is necessary now, counters table should be empty 
7492          self.cursor.execute("DELETE FROM counters;") 
7493          # assign a counter to an idpackage 
7494          myids = self.listAllIdpackages() 
7495          counter_path = etpConst['spm']['xpak_entries']['counter'] 
7496          for myid in myids: 
7497              # get atom 
7498              myatom = self.retrieveAtom(myid) 
7499              mybranch = self.retrieveBranch(myid) 
7500              myatom = self.entropyTools.remove_tag(myatom) 
7501              myatomcounterpath = "%s%s/%s" % (vdb_path, myatom, counter_path,) 
7502              if os.path.isfile(myatomcounterpath): 
7503                  try: 
7504                      with open(myatomcounterpath, "r") as f: 
7505                          counter = int(f.readline().strip()) 
7506                  except: 
7507                      if output: 
7508                          mytxt = "%s: %s: %s" % ( 
7509                              bold(_("ATTENTION")), 
7510                              red(_("cannot open Spm counter file for")), 
7511                              bold(myatom), 
7512                          ) 
7513                          self.updateProgress( 
7514                              mytxt, 
7515                              importance = 1, 
7516                              type = "warning" 
7517                          ) 
7518                      continue 
7519                  # insert id+counter 
7520                  with self.__write_mutex: 
7521                      try: 
7522                          self.cursor.execute( 
7523                                  'INSERT into counters VALUES ' 
7524                                  '(?,?,?)', ( counter, myid, mybranch ) 
7525                          ) 
7526                      except self.dbapi2.IntegrityError: 
7527                          if output: 
7528                              mytxt = "%s: %s: %s" % ( 
7529                                  bold(_("ATTENTION")), 
7530                                  red(_("counter for atom is duplicated, ignoring")), 
7531                                  bold(myatom), 
7532                              ) 
7533                              self.updateProgress( 
7534                                  mytxt, 
7535                                  importance = 1, 
7536                                  type = "warning" 
7537                              ) 
7538                          continue 
7539                          # don't trust counters, they might not be unique 
7540   
7541          self.commitChanges() 

7542

7717 -    def regenerateDependsTable(self, output = True): 

7718          """ 
7719          docstring_title 
7720   
7721          @keyword output: 
7722          @type output: 
7723          @return: 
7724          @rtype: 
7725   
7726          """ 
7727   
7728          depends = self.listAllDependencies() 
7729          count = 0 
7730          total = len(depends) 
7731          mydata = set() 
7732          am = self.atomMatch 
7733          up = self.updateProgress 
7734          self.clearDependsTable() 
7735          for iddep, atom in depends: 
7736              count += 1 
7737   
7738              if output and ((count == 0) or (count % 150 == 0) or \ 
7739                  (count == total)): 
7740                  up( red("Resolving %s") % (atom,), importance = 0, 
7741                      type = "info", back = True, count = (count, total) 
7742                  ) 
7743   
7744              idpackage, rc = am(atom) 
7745              if idpackage is -1: 
7746                  continue 
7747              if iddep is -1: 
7748                  continue 
7749              mydata.add((iddep, idpackage)) 
7750   
7751          if mydata: 
7752              try: 
7753                  self.addDependsRelationToDependsTable(mydata) 
7754              except self.dbapi2.IntegrityError: 
7755                  # try to cope for the last time 
7756                  self.clearDependsTable() 
7757                  self.commitChanges() 
7758                  self.addDependsRelationToDependsTable(mydata) 
7759   
7760          # now validate dependstable 
7761          self.sanitizeDependsTable()

7860 -    def atomMatchValidateCache(self, cached_obj, multiMatch, extendedResults): 

7861          """ 
7862          docstring_title 
7863   
7864          @param cached_obj: 
7865          @type cached_obj: 
7866          @param multiMatch: 
7867          @type multiMatch: 
7868          @param extendedResults: 
7869          @type extendedResults: 
7870          @return: 
7871          @rtype: 
7872   
7873          """ 
7874   
7875          # time wasted for a reason 
7876          data, rc = cached_obj 
7877          if rc != 0: return cached_obj 
7878   
7879          if (not extendedResults) and (not multiMatch): 
7880              if not self.isIdpackageAvailable(data): 
7881                  return None 
7882          elif extendedResults and (not multiMatch): 
7883              # ((idpackage,0,version,versiontag,revision,),0) 
7884              if not self.isIdpackageAvailable(data[0]): 
7885                  return None 
7886          elif extendedResults and multiMatch: 
7887              # (set([(idpackage,0,version,version_tag,revision) for x in dbpkginfo]),0) 
7888              idpackages = set([x[0] for x in data]) 
7889              if not self.areIdpackagesAvailable(idpackages): 
7890                  return None 
7891          elif (not extendedResults) and multiMatch: 
7892              # (set([x[0] for x in dbpkginfo]),0) 
7893              idpackages = set(data) 
7894              if not self.areIdpackagesAvailable(idpackages): 
7895                  return None 
7896   
7897          return cached_obj

7906          @type reponame:

7908          @rtype: 
7909   
7910          """

7913              return -1, self.SystemSettings['pkg_masking_reference']['user_live_mask']

7915              return idpackage, self.SystemSettings['pkg_masking_reference']['user_live_unmask']

7917 -    def _idpackageValidator_user_package_mask(self, idpackage, reponame, live): 

7918          """ 
7919          docstring_title 
7920   
7921          @param idpackage: package indentifier 
7922          @type idpackage: int 
7923          @param reponame: 
7924          @type reponame: 
7925          @param live: 
7926          @type live: 
7927          @return: 
7928          @rtype: 
7929   
7930          """ 
7931          # check if user package.mask needs it masked 
7932   
7933          mykw = "%smask_ids" % (reponame,) 
7934          user_package_mask_ids = self.SystemSettings.get(mykw) 
7935          if not isinstance(user_package_mask_ids, (list, set,)): 
7936              user_package_mask_ids = set() 
7937              for atom in self.SystemSettings['mask']: 
7938                  matches, r = self.atomMatch(atom, multiMatch = True, packagesFilter = False) 
7939                  if r != 0: 
7940                      continue 
7941                  user_package_mask_ids |= set(matches) 
7942              self.SystemSettings[mykw] = user_package_mask_ids 
7943          if idpackage in user_package_mask_ids: 
7944              # sorry, masked 
7945              myr = self.SystemSettings['pkg_masking_reference']['user_package_mask'] 
7946              try: 
7947                  validator_cache = self.SystemSettings[self.client_settings_plugin_id]['masking_validation']['cache'] 
7948                  validator_cache[(idpackage, reponame, live)] = -1, myr 
7949              except KeyError: # system settings client plugin not found 
7950                  pass 
7951              return -1, myr 

7952

7960          @type reponame:

7962          @type live:

7965

7983              except KeyError: # system settings client plugin not found 
7984                  pass 
7985              return idpackage, myr

7987 -    def _idpackageValidator_packages_db_mask(self, idpackage, reponame, live): 

7988          """ 
7989          docstring_title 
7990   
7991          @param idpackage: package indentifier 
7992          @type idpackage: int 
7993          @param reponame: 
7994          @type reponame: 
7995          @param live: 
7996          @type live: 
7997          @return: 
7998          @rtype: 
7999   
8000          """ 
8001          # check if repository packages.db.mask needs it masked 
8002          repos_mask = {} 
8003          client_plg_id = etpConst['system_settings_plugins_ids']['client_plugin'] 
8004          client_settings = self.SystemSettings.get(client_plg_id, {}) 
8005          if client_settings: 
8006              repos_mask = client_settings['repositories']['mask'] 
8007          repomask = repos_mask.get(reponame) 
8008          if isinstance(repomask, (list, set,)): 
8009              # first, seek into generic masking, all branches 
8010              mask_repo_id = "%s_ids@@:of:%s" % (reponame, reponame,) # avoid issues with repository names 
8011              repomask_ids = repos_mask.get(mask_repo_id) 
8012              if not isinstance(repomask_ids, set): 
8013                  repomask_ids = set() 
8014                  for atom in repomask: 
8015                      matches, r = self.atomMatch(atom, multiMatch = True, packagesFilter = False) 
8016                      if r != 0: 
8017                          continue 
8018                      repomask_ids |= set(matches) 
8019                  repos_mask[mask_repo_id] = repomask_ids 
8020              if idpackage in repomask_ids: 
8021                  myr = self.SystemSettings['pkg_masking_reference']['repository_packages_db_mask'] 
8022                  try: 
8023                      validator_cache = self.SystemSettings[self.client_settings_plugin_id]['masking_validation']['cache'] 
8024                      validator_cache[(idpackage, reponame, live)] = -1, myr 
8025                  except KeyError: # system settings client plugin not found 
8026                      pass 
8027                  return -1, myr

8029 -    def _idpackageValidator_package_license_mask(self, idpackage, reponame, live):

8057 -    def _idpackageValidator_keyword_mask(self, idpackage, reponame, live): 

8058          """ 
8059          docstring_title 
8060   
8061          @param idpackage: package indentifier 
8062          @type idpackage: int 
8063          @param reponame: 
8064          @type reponame: 
8065          @param live: 
8066          @type live: 
8067          @return: 
8068          @rtype: 
8069   
8070          """ 
8071   
8072          mykeywords = self.retrieveKeywords(idpackage) 
8073          # WORKAROUND for buggy entries 
8074          if not mykeywords: mykeywords = [''] # ** is fine then 
8075          # firstly, check if package keywords are in etpConst['keywords'] 
8076          # (universal keywords have been merged from package.mask) 
8077          for key in etpConst['keywords']: 
8078              if key not in mykeywords: continue 
8079              myr = self.SystemSettings['pkg_masking_reference']['system_keyword'] 
8080              try: 
8081                  validator_cache = self.SystemSettings[self.client_settings_plugin_id]['masking_validation']['cache'] 
8082                  validator_cache[(idpackage, reponame, live)] = idpackage, myr 
8083              except KeyError: # system settings client plugin not found 
8084                  pass 
8085              return idpackage, myr 
8086   
8087          # if we get here, it means we didn't find mykeywords in etpConst['keywords'] 
8088          # we need to seek self.SystemSettings['keywords'] 
8089          # seek in repository first 
8090          if reponame in self.SystemSettings['keywords']['repositories']: 
8091              for keyword in self.SystemSettings['keywords']['repositories'][reponame]: 
8092                  if keyword not in mykeywords: continue 
8093                  keyword_data = self.SystemSettings['keywords']['repositories'][reponame].get(keyword) 
8094                  if not keyword_data: continue 
8095                  if "*" in keyword_data: # all packages in this repo with keyword "keyword" are ok 
8096                      myr = self.SystemSettings['pkg_masking_reference']['user_repo_package_keywords_all'] 
8097                      try: 
8098                          validator_cache = self.SystemSettings[self.client_settings_plugin_id]['masking_validation']['cache'] 
8099                          validator_cache[(idpackage, reponame, live)] = idpackage, myr 
8100                      except KeyError: # system settings client plugin not found 
8101                          pass 
8102                      return idpackage, myr 
8103                  kwd_key = "%s_ids" % (keyword,) 
8104                  keyword_data_ids = self.SystemSettings['keywords']['repositories'][reponame].get(kwd_key) 
8105                  if not isinstance(keyword_data_ids, set): 
8106                      keyword_data_ids = set() 
8107                      for atom in keyword_data: 
8108                          matches, r = self.atomMatch(atom, multiMatch = True, packagesFilter = False) 
8109                          if r != 0: 
8110                              continue 
8111                          keyword_data_ids |= matches 
8112                      self.SystemSettings['keywords']['repositories'][reponame][kwd_key] = keyword_data_ids 
8113                  if idpackage in keyword_data_ids: 
8114                      myr = self.SystemSettings['pkg_masking_reference']['user_repo_package_keywords'] 
8115                      try: 
8116                          validator_cache = self.SystemSettings[self.client_settings_plugin_id]['masking_validation']['cache'] 
8117                          validator_cache[(idpackage, reponame, live)] = idpackage, myr 
8118                      except KeyError: # system settings client plugin not found 
8119                          pass 
8120                      return idpackage, myr 
8121   
8122          # if we get here, it means we didn't find a match in repositories 
8123          # so we scan packages, last chance 
8124          for keyword in self.SystemSettings['keywords']['packages']: 
8125              # first of all check if keyword is in mykeywords 
8126              if keyword not in mykeywords: continue 
8127              keyword_data = self.SystemSettings['keywords']['packages'].get(keyword) 
8128              if not keyword_data: continue 
8129              kwd_key = "%s_ids" % (keyword,) 
8130              keyword_data_ids = self.SystemSettings['keywords']['packages'].get(reponame+kwd_key) 
8131              if not isinstance(keyword_data_ids, (list, set,)): 
8132                  keyword_data_ids = set() 
8133                  for atom in keyword_data: 
8134                      # match atom 
8135                      matches, r = self.atomMatch(atom, multiMatch = True, packagesFilter = False) 
8136                      if r != 0: 
8137                          continue 
8138                      keyword_data_ids |= matches 
8139                  self.SystemSettings['keywords']['packages'][reponame+kwd_key] = keyword_data_ids 
8140              if idpackage in keyword_data_ids: 
8141                  # valid! 
8142                  myr = self.SystemSettings['pkg_masking_reference']['user_package_keywords'] 
8143                  try: 
8144                      validator_cache = self.SystemSettings[self.client_settings_plugin_id]['masking_validation']['cache'] 
8145                      validator_cache[(idpackage, reponame, live)] = idpackage, myr 
8146                  except KeyError: # system settings client plugin not found 
8147                      pass 
8148                  return idpackage, myr 

8149   
8150   
8151   
8152      # function that validate one atom by reading keywords settings 
8153      # validator_cache = self.SystemSettings[self.client_settings_plugin_id]['masking_validation']['cache'] 

8154 -    def idpackageValidator(self, idpackage, live = True): 

8155          """ 
8156          docstring_title 
8157   
8158          @param idpackage: package indentifier 
8159          @type idpackage: int 
8160          @keyword live: 
8161          @type live: 
8162          @return: 
8163          @rtype: 
8164   
8165          """ 
8166   
8167          if self.dbname == etpConst['clientdbid']: 
8168              return idpackage, 0 
8169          elif self.dbname.startswith(etpConst['serverdbid']): 
8170              return idpackage, 0 
8171   
8172          reponame = self.dbname[len(etpConst['dbnamerepoprefix']):] 
8173          try: 
8174              validator_cache = self.SystemSettings[self.client_settings_plugin_id]['masking_validation']['cache'] 
8175              cached = validator_cache.get((idpackage, reponame, live)) 
8176              if cached != None: 
8177                  return cached 
8178              # avoid memleaks 
8179              if len(validator_cache) > 10000: 
8180                  validator_cache.clear() 
8181          except KeyError: # plugin does not exist 
8182              pass 
8183   
8184          if live: 
8185              data = self._idpackageValidator_live(idpackage, reponame) 
8186              if data: return data 
8187   
8188          data = self._idpackageValidator_user_package_mask(idpackage, reponame, live) 
8189          if data: return data 
8190   
8191          data = self._idpackageValidator_user_package_unmask(idpackage, reponame, live) 
8192          if data: return data 
8193   
8194          data = self._idpackageValidator_packages_db_mask(idpackage, reponame, live) 
8195          if data: return data 
8196   
8197          data = self._idpackageValidator_package_license_mask(idpackage, reponame, live) 
8198          if data: return data 
8199   
8200          data = self._idpackageValidator_keyword_mask(idpackage, reponame, live) 
8201          if data: return data 
8202   
8203          # holy crap, can't validate 
8204          myr = self.SystemSettings['pkg_masking_reference']['completely_masked'] 
8205          validator_cache[(idpackage, reponame, live)] = -1, myr 
8206          return -1, myr

8208      # packages filter used by atomMatch, input must me foundIDs, a list like this:

8212          docstring_title

8214          @param results: 
8215          @type results: 
8216          @return: 
8217          @rtype: 
8218   
8219          """ 
8220          # keywordsFilter ONLY FILTERS results if 
8221          # self.dbname.startswith(etpConst['dbnamerepoprefix']) => repository database is open 
8222          if not self.dbname.startswith(etpConst['dbnamerepoprefix']): 
8223              return results

8226          for idpackage in results: 
8227              idpackage, reason = self.idpackageValidator(idpackage) 
8228              if idpackage is -1: continue

8232 -    def __filterSlot(self, idpackage, slot): 

8233          if slot is None: 
8234              return idpackage 
8235          dbslot = self.retrieveSlot(idpackage) 
8236          if dbslot == slot:

8239 -    def __filterTag(self, idpackage, tag, operators): 

8240          if tag is None: 
8241              return idpackage 
8242          dbtag = self.retrieveVersionTag(idpackage) 
8243          compare = cmp(tag, dbtag) 
8244          if not operators or operators == "=": 
8245              if compare == 0: 
8246                  return idpackage 
8247          else: 
8248              return self.__do_operator_compare(idpackage, operators, compare) 

8249   

8250 -    def __filterUse(self, idpackage, use): 

8251          if not use: 
8252              return idpackage 
8253          pkguse = self.retrieveUseflags(idpackage) 
8254          disabled = set([x[1:] for x in use if x.startswith("-")]) 
8255          enabled = set([x for x in use if not x.startswith("-")]) 
8256          enabled_not_satisfied = enabled - pkguse 
8257          # check enabled 
8258          if enabled_not_satisfied: 
8259              return None 
8260          # check disabled 
8261          disabled_not_satisfied = disabled - pkguse 
8262          if len(disabled_not_satisfied) != len(disabled): 
8263              return None 
8264          return idpackage 

8265   

8266 -    def __do_operator_compare(self, token, operators, compare): 

8267          if operators == ">" and compare is -1: 
8268              return token 
8269          elif operators == ">=" and compare < 1: 
8270              return token 
8271          elif operators == "<" and compare == 1: 
8272              return token 
8273          elif operators == "<=" and compare > -1: 
8274              return token 

8275

8281              if not idpackage: 
8282                  return False 
8283

8285              if not idpackage: 
8286                  return False 
8287

8289              if not idpackage: 
8290                  return False 
8291   
8292              return True

8296 -    def atomMatch(self, atom, caseSensitive = True, matchSlot = None, multiMatch = False, 
8297              matchBranches = (), matchTag = None, matchUse = (), packagesFilter = True, 
8298              matchRevision = None, extendedResults = False, useCache = True ): 

8299   
8300          """ 
8301   
8302          @description: matches the user chosen package name+ver, if possibile, in a single repository 
8303          @input atom: string, atom to match 
8304          @input caseSensitive: bool, should the atom be parsed case sensitive? 
8305          @input matchSlot: string, match atoms with the provided slot 
8306          @input multiMatch: bool, return all the available atoms 
8307          @input matchBranches: tuple or list, match packages only in the specified branches 
8308          @input matchTag: match packages only for the specified tag 
8309          @input matchUse: match packages only if it owns the specified use flags 
8310          @input packagesFilter: enable/disable package.mask/.keywords/.unmask filter 
8311          @output: the package id, if found, otherwise -1 plus the status, 0 = ok, 1 = error 
8312   
8313          """ 
8314   
8315          if not atom: 
8316              return -1, 1 
8317   
8318          if useCache: 
8319              cached = self.atomMatchFetchCache( 
8320                  atom, caseSensitive, matchSlot, 
8321                  multiMatch, matchBranches, matchTag, 
8322                  matchUse, packagesFilter, matchRevision, 
8323                  extendedResults 
8324              ) 
8325              if isinstance(cached, tuple): 
8326                  try: 
8327                      cached = self.atomMatchValidateCache(cached, multiMatch, extendedResults) 
8328                  except (TypeError, ValueError, IndexError, KeyError,): 
8329                      cached = None 
8330              if isinstance(cached, tuple): 
8331                  return cached 
8332   
8333          atomTag = self.entropyTools.dep_gettag(atom) 
8334          try: 
8335              atomUse = self.entropyTools.dep_getusedeps(atom) 
8336          except InvalidAtom: 
8337              atomUse = () 
8338          atomSlot = self.entropyTools.dep_getslot(atom) 
8339          atomRev = self.entropyTools.dep_get_entropy_revision(atom) 
8340          if isinstance(atomRev, (int, long,)): 
8341              if atomRev < 0: atomRev = None 
8342   
8343          # use match 
8344          scan_atom = self.entropyTools.remove_usedeps(atom) 
8345          if (not matchUse) and (atomUse): 
8346              matchUse = atomUse 
8347   
8348          # tag match 
8349          scan_atom = self.entropyTools.remove_tag(scan_atom) 
8350          if (matchTag is None) and (atomTag != None): 
8351              matchTag = atomTag 
8352   
8353          # slot match 
8354          scan_atom = self.entropyTools.remove_slot(scan_atom) 
8355          if (matchSlot is None) and (atomSlot != None): 
8356              matchSlot = atomSlot 
8357   
8358          # revision match 
8359          scan_atom = self.entropyTools.remove_entropy_revision(scan_atom) 
8360          if (matchRevision is None) and (atomRev != None): 
8361              matchRevision = atomRev 
8362   
8363          branch_list = () 
8364          direction = '' 
8365          justname = True 
8366          pkgkey = '' 
8367          strippedAtom = '' 
8368          foundIDs = [] 
8369          dbpkginfo = set() 
8370   
8371          if scan_atom: 
8372   
8373              while 1: 
8374                  pkgversion = '' 
8375                  # check for direction 
8376                  strippedAtom = self.entropyTools.dep_getcpv(scan_atom) 
8377                  if scan_atom[-1] == "*": 
8378                      strippedAtom += "*" 
8379                  direction = scan_atom[0:len(scan_atom)-len(strippedAtom)] 
8380   
8381                  justname = self.entropyTools.isjustname(strippedAtom) 
8382                  pkgkey = strippedAtom 
8383                  if justname == 0: 
8384                      # get version 
8385                      data = self.entropyTools.catpkgsplit(strippedAtom) 
8386                      if data is None: break # badly formatted 
8387                      pkgversion = data[2]+"-"+data[3] 
8388                      pkgkey = self.entropyTools.dep_getkey(strippedAtom) 
8389   
8390                  splitkey = pkgkey.split("/") 
8391                  if (len(splitkey) == 2): 
8392                      pkgname = splitkey[1] 
8393                      pkgcat = splitkey[0] 
8394                  else: 
8395                      pkgname = splitkey[0] 
8396                      pkgcat = "null" 
8397   
8398                  branch_list = (self.db_branch,) 
8399                  if matchBranches: 
8400                      # force to tuple for security 
8401                      branch_list = tuple(matchBranches) 
8402                  break 
8403   
8404

8407              foundIDs = self.__generate_found_ids_match(branch_list, pkgkey, pkgname, pkgcat, caseSensitive, multiMatch) 
8408   
8409          ### FILTERING 
8410          # filter slot and tag 
8411          if foundIDs: 
8412              foundIDs = self.__filterSlotTagUse(foundIDs, matchSlot, matchTag, matchUse, direction)

8414                  foundIDs = self.packagesFilter(foundIDs) 
8415          ### END FILTERING 
8416

8418              dbpkginfo = self.__handle_found_ids_match(foundIDs, direction, matchTag, matchRevision, justname, strippedAtom, pkgversion)

8421              if extendedResults: 
8422                  if multiMatch: 
8423                      x = set() 
8424                  else: 
8425                      x = (-1, 1, None, None, None,)

8427                      atom, caseSensitive, matchSlot,

8431                  )

8439                      atom, caseSensitive, matchSlot, 
8440                      multiMatch, matchBranches, matchTag, 
8441                      matchUse, packagesFilter, matchRevision, 
8442                      extendedResults, result = (x, 1) 
8443                  ) 
8444                  return x, 1

8450                      atom, caseSensitive, matchSlot, 
8451                      multiMatch, matchBranches, matchTag, 
8452                      matchUse, packagesFilter, matchRevision, 
8453                      extendedResults, result = (x, 0) 
8454                  ) 
8455                  return x, 0 
8456              else: 
8457                  x = set([x[0] for x in dbpkginfo])

8459                      atom, caseSensitive, matchSlot, 
8460                      multiMatch, matchBranches, matchTag,

8462                      extendedResults, result = (x, 0) 
8463                  ) 
8464                  return x, 0

8471                      atom, caseSensitive, matchSlot, 
8472                      multiMatch, matchBranches, matchTag,

8479                      atom, caseSensitive, matchSlot, 
8480                      multiMatch, matchBranches, matchTag, 
8481                      matchUse, packagesFilter, matchRevision, 
8482                      extendedResults, result = (x[0], 0)

8507                  multiMatch, matchBranches, matchTag,
